                     <div class="line">Me, uncle?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">You, cousin</div>
                     <div class="line">Within these ten days if that thou be'st found</div>
                     <div class="line">So near our public court as twenty miles,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou diest for it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me the knowledge of my fault bear with me:</div>
                     <div class="line">If with myself I hold intelligence</div>
                     <div class="line">Or have acquaintance with mine own desires,</div>
                     <div class="line">If that I do not dream or be not frantic,--</div>
                     <div class="line">As I do trust I am not--then, dear uncle,</div>
                     <div class="line">Never so much as in a thought unborn</div>
                     <div class="line">Did I offend your highness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus do all traitors:</div>
                     <div class="line">If their purgation did consist in words,</div>
                     <div class="line">They are as innocent as grace itself:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it suffice thee that I trust thee not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet your mistrust cannot make me a traitor:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me whereon the likelihood depends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art thy father's daughter; there's enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">So was I when your highness took his dukedom;</div>
                     <div class="line">So was I when your highness banish'd him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Treason is not inherited, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if we did derive it from our friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that to me? my father was no traitor:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, good my liege, mistake me not so much</div>
                     <div class="line">To think my poverty is treacherous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear sovereign, hear me speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Celia; we stay'd her for your sake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Else had she with her father ranged along.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I did not then entreat to have her stay;</div>
                     <div class="line">It was your pleasure and your own remorse:</div>
                     <div class="line">I was too young that time to value her;</div>
                     <div class="line">But now I know her: if she be a traitor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why so am I; we still have slept together,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rose at an instant, learn'd, play'd, eat together,</div>
                     <div class="line">And wheresoever we went, like Juno's swans,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still we went coupled and inseparable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">She is too subtle for thee; and her smoothness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her very silence and her patience</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak to the people, and they pity her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a fool: she robs thee of thy name;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou wilt show more bright and seem more virtuous</div>
                     <div class="line">When she is gone. Then open not thy lips:</div>
                     <div class="line">Firm and irrevocable is my doom</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I have pass'd upon her; she is banish'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pronounce that sentence then on me, my liege:</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot live out of her company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">You are a fool. You, niece, provide yourself:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you outstay the time, upon mine honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the greatness of my word, you die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt DUKE FREDERICK and Lords</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O my poor Rosalind, whither wilt thou go?</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou change fathers? I will give thee mine.</div>
                     <div class="line">I charge thee, be not thou more grieved than I am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I have more cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast not, cousin;</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee be cheerful: know'st thou not, the duke</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath banish'd me, his daughter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">That he hath not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, hath not? Rosalind lacks then the love</div>
                     <div class="line">Which teacheth thee that thou and I am one:</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we be sunder'd? shall we part, sweet girl?</div>
                     <div class="line">No: let my father seek another heir.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore devise with me how we may fly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither to go and what to bear with us;</div>
                     <div class="line">And do not seek to take your change upon you,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear your griefs yourself and leave me out;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by this heaven, now at our sorrows pale,</div>
                     <div class="line">Say what thou canst, I'll go along with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, whither shall we go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">To seek my uncle in the forest of Arden.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, what danger will it be to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Maids as we are, to travel forth so far!</div>
                     <div class="line">Beauty provoketh thieves sooner than gold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll put myself in poor and mean attire</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a kind of umber smirch my face;</div>
                     <div class="line">The like do you: so shall we pass along</div>
                     <div class="line">And never stir assailants.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Were it not better,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because that I am more than common tall,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I did suit me all points like a man?</div>
                     <div class="line">A gallant curtle-axe upon my thigh,</div>
                     <div class="line">A boar-spear in my hand; and--in my heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Lie there what hidden woman's fear there will--</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll have a swashing and a martial outside,</div>
                     <div class="line">As many other mannish cowards have</div>
                     <div class="line">That do outface it with their semblances.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall I call thee when thou art a man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have no worse a name than Jove's own page;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore look you call me Ganymede.</div>
                     <div class="line">But what will you be call'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Something that hath a reference to my state</div>
                     <div class="line">No longer Celia, but Aliena.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">But, cousin, what if we assay'd to steal</div>
                     <div class="line">The clownish fool out of your father's court?</div>
                     <div class="line">Would he not be a comfort to our travel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll go along o'er the wide world with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave me alone to woo him. Let's away,</div>
                     <div class="line">And get our jewels and our wealth together,</div>
                     <div class="line">Devise the fittest time and safest way</div>
                     <div class="line">To hide us from pursuit that will be made</div>
                     <div class="line">After my flight. Now go we in content</div>
                     <div class="line">To liberty and not to banishment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  The Forest of Arden.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  A room in the palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  Before OLIVER'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  The Forest of Arden.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE V.  The Forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.7">6. SCENE VI.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.8">7. SCENE VII.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The Forest of Arden.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE SENIOR, AMIENS, and two or three Lords,
like foresters</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, my co-mates and brothers in exile,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath not old custom made this life more sweet</div>
                     <div class="line">Than that of painted pomp? Are not these woods</div>
                     <div class="line">More free from peril than the envious court?</div>
                     <div class="line">Here feel we but the penalty of Adam,</div>
                     <div class="line">The seasons' difference, as the icy fang</div>
                     <div class="line">And churlish chiding of the winter's wind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, when it bites and blows upon my body,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even till I shrink with cold, I smile and say</div>
                     <div class="line">'This is no flattery: these are counsellors</div>
                     <div class="line">That feelingly persuade me what I am.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet are the uses of adversity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, like the toad, ugly and venomous,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wears yet a precious jewel in his head;</div>
                     <div class="line">And this our life exempt from public haunt</div>
                     <div class="line">Finds tongues in trees, books in the running brooks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sermons in stones and good in every thing.</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not change it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">Happy is your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">That can translate the stubbornness of fortune</div>
                     <div class="line">Into so quiet and so sweet a style.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, shall we go and kill us venison?</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet it irks me the poor dappled fools,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being native burghers of this desert city,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should in their own confines with forked heads</div>
                     <div class="line">Have their round haunches gored.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">The melancholy Jaques grieves at that,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in that kind, swears you do more usurp</div>
                     <div class="line">Than doth your brother that hath banish'd you.</div>
                     <div class="line">To-day my Lord of Amiens and myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Did steal behind him as he lay along</div>
                     <div class="line">Under an oak whose antique root peeps out</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the brook that brawls along this wood:</div>
                     <div class="line">To the which place a poor sequester'd stag,</div>
                     <div class="line">That from the hunter's aim had ta'en a hurt,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did come to languish, and indeed, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">The wretched animal heaved forth such groans</div>
                     <div class="line">That their discharge did stretch his leathern coat</div>
                     <div class="line">Almost to bursting, and the big round tears</div>
                     <div class="line">Coursed one another down his innocent nose</div>
                     <div class="line">In piteous chase; and thus the hairy fool</div>
                     <div class="line">Much marked of the melancholy Jaques,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stood on the extremest verge of the swift brook,</div>
                     <div class="line">Augmenting it with tears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">But what said Jaques?</div>
                     <div class="line">Did he not moralize this spectacle?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">O, yes, into a thousand similes.</div>
                     <div class="line">First, for his weeping into the needless stream;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Poor deer,' quoth he, 'thou makest a testament</div>
                     <div class="line">As worldlings do, giving thy sum of more</div>
                     <div class="line">To that which had too much:' then, being there alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Left and abandon'd of his velvet friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">''Tis right:' quoth he; 'thus misery doth part</div>
                     <div class="line">The flux of company:' anon a careless herd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of the pasture, jumps along by him</div>
                     <div class="line">And never stays to greet him; 'Ay' quoth Jaques,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Sweep on, you fat and greasy citizens;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis just the fashion: wherefore do you look</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon that poor and broken bankrupt there?'</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus most invectively he pierceth through</div>
                     <div class="line">The body of the country, city, court,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, and of this our life, swearing that we</div>
                     <div class="line">Are mere usurpers, tyrants and what's worse,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fright the animals and to kill them up</div>
                     <div class="line">In their assign'd and native dwelling-place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">And did you leave him in this contemplation?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">We did, my lord, weeping and commenting</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the sobbing deer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Show me the place:</div>
                     <div class="line">I love to cope him in these sullen fits,</div>
                     <div class="line">For then he's full of matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bring you to him straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A room in the palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE FREDERICK, with Lords</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Can it be possible that no man saw them?</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be: some villains of my court</div>
                     <div class="line">Are of consent and sufferance in this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot hear of any that did see her.</div>
                     <div class="line">The ladies, her attendants of her chamber,</div>
                     <div class="line">Saw her abed, and in the morning early</div>
                     <div class="line">They found the bed untreasured of their mistress.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, the roynish clown, at whom so oft</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grace was wont to laugh, is also missing.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hisperia, the princess' gentlewoman,</div>
                     <div class="line">Confesses that she secretly o'erheard</div>
                     <div class="line">Your daughter and her cousin much commend</div>
                     <div class="line">The parts and graces of the wrestler</div>
                     <div class="line">That did but lately foil the sinewy Charles;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she believes, wherever they are gone,</div>
                     <div class="line">That youth is surely in their company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Send to his brother; fetch that gallant hither;</div>
                     <div class="line">If he be absent, bring his brother to me;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make him find him: do this suddenly,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let not search and inquisition quail</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring again these foolish runaways.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Before OLIVER'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ORLANDO and ADAM, meeting</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What, my young master? O, my gentle master!</div>
                     <div class="line">O my sweet master! O you memory</div>
                     <div class="line">Of old Sir Rowland! why, what make you here?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why are you virtuous? why do people love you?</div>
                     <div class="line">And wherefore are you gentle, strong and valiant?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why would you be so fond to overcome</div>
                     <div class="line">The bonny priser of the humorous duke?</div>
                     <div class="line">Your praise is come too swiftly home before you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Know you not, master, to some kind of men</div>
                     <div class="line">Their graces serve them but as enemies?</div>
                     <div class="line">No more do yours: your virtues, gentle master,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are sanctified and holy traitors to you.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, what a world is this, when what is comely</div>
                     <div class="line">Envenoms him that bears it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADAM</div>
                     <div class="line">O unhappy youth!</div>
                     <div class="line">Come not within these doors; within this roof</div>
                     <div class="line">The enemy of all your graces lives:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your brother--no, no brother; yet the son--</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet not the son, I will not call him son</div>
                     <div class="line">Of him I was about to call his father--</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath heard your praises, and this night he means</div>
                     <div class="line">To burn the lodging where you use to lie</div>
                     <div class="line">And you within it: if he fail of that,</div>
                     <div class="line">He will have other means to cut you off.</div>
                     <div class="line">I overheard him and his practises.</div>
                     <div class="line">This is no place; this house is but a butchery:</div>
                     <div class="line">Abhor it, fear it, do not enter it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, whither, Adam, wouldst thou have me go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADAM</div>
                     <div class="line">No matter whither, so you come not here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">What, wouldst thou have me go and beg my food?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or with a base and boisterous sword enforce</div>
                     <div class="line">A thievish living on the common road?</div>
                     <div class="line">This I must do, or know not what to do:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet this I will not do, do how I can;</div>
                     <div class="line">I rather will subject me to the malice</div>
                     <div class="line">Of a diverted blood and bloody brother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADAM</div>
                     <div class="line">But do not so. I have five hundred crowns,</div>
                     <div class="line">The thrifty hire I saved under your father,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I did store to be my foster-nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">When service should in my old limbs lie lame</div>
                     <div class="line">And unregarded age in corners thrown:</div>
                     <div class="line">Take that, and He that doth the ravens feed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, providently caters for the sparrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be comfort to my age! Here is the gold;</div>
                     <div class="line">And all this I give you. Let me be your servant:</div>
                     <div class="line">Though I look old, yet I am strong and lusty;</div>
                     <div class="line">For in my youth I never did apply</div>
                     <div class="line">Hot and rebellious liquors in my blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor did not with unbashful forehead woo</div>
                     <div class="line">The means of weakness and debility;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore my age is as a lusty winter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Frosty, but kindly: let me go with you;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll do the service of a younger man</div>
                     <div class="line">In all your business and necessities.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">O good old man, how well in thee appears</div>
                     <div class="line">The constant service of the antique world,</div>
                     <div class="line">When service sweat for duty, not for meed!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art not for the fashion of these times,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where none will sweat but for promotion,</div>
                     <div class="line">And having that, do choke their service up</div>
                     <div class="line">Even with the having: it is not so with thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, poor old man, thou prunest a rotten tree,</div>
                     <div class="line">That cannot so much as a blossom yield</div>
                     <div class="line">In lieu of all thy pains and husbandry</div>
                     <div class="line">But come thy ways; well go along together,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ere we have thy youthful wages spent,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll light upon some settled low content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, go on, and I will follow thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the last gasp, with truth and loyalty.</div>
                     <div class="line">From seventeen years till now almost fourscore</div>
                     <div class="line">Here lived I, but now live here no more.</div>
                     <div class="line">At seventeen years many their fortunes seek;</div>
                     <div class="line">But at fourscore it is too late a week:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet fortune cannot recompense me better</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to die well and not my master's debtor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The Forest of Arden.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSALIND for Ganymede, CELIA for Aliena,
and TOUCHSTONE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">O Jupiter, how weary are my spirits!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">I care not for my spirits, if my legs were not weary.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I could find in my heart to disgrace my man's</div>
                     <div class="line">apparel and to cry like a woman; but I must comfort</div>
                     <div class="line">the weaker vessel, as doublet and hose ought to show</div>
                     <div class="line">itself courageous to petticoat: therefore courage,</div>
                     <div class="line">good Aliena!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, bear with me; I cannot go no further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">For my part, I had rather bear with you than bear</div>
                     <div class="line">you; yet I should bear no cross if I did bear you,</div>
                     <div class="line">for I think you have no money in your purse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, this is the forest of Arden.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, now am I in Arden; the more fool I; when I was</div>
                     <div class="line">at home, I was in a better place: but travellers</div>
                     <div class="line">must be content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, be so, good Touchstone.</div>
                     <p>Enter CORIN and SILVIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Look you, who comes here; a young man and an old in</div>
                     <div class="line">solemn talk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the way to make her scorn you still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O Corin, that thou knew'st how I do love her!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">I partly guess; for I have loved ere now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Corin, being old, thou canst not guess,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though in thy youth thou wast as true a lover</div>
                     <div class="line">As ever sigh'd upon a midnight pillow:</div>
                     <div class="line">But if thy love were ever like to mine--</div>
                     <div class="line">As sure I think did never man love so--</div>
                     <div class="line">How many actions most ridiculous</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou been drawn to by thy fantasy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Into a thousand that I have forgotten.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, thou didst then ne'er love so heartily!</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou remember'st not the slightest folly</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever love did make thee run into,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast not loved:</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if thou hast not sat as I do now,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wearying thy hearer in thy mistress' praise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast not loved:</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if thou hast not broke from company</div>
                     <div class="line">Abruptly, as my passion now makes me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast not loved.</div>
                     <div class="line">O Phebe, Phebe, Phebe!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor shepherd! searching of thy wound,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have by hard adventure found mine own.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">And I mine. I remember, when I was in love I broke</div>
                     <div class="line">my sword upon a stone and bid him take that for</div>
                     <div class="line">coming a-night to Jane Smile; and I remember the</div>
                     <div class="line">kissing of her batlet and the cow's dugs that her</div>
                     <div class="line">pretty chopt hands had milked; and I remember the</div>
                     <div class="line">wooing of a peascod instead of her, from whom I took</div>
                     <div class="line">two cods and, giving her them again, said with</div>
                     <div class="line">weeping tears 'Wear these for my sake.' We that are</div>
                     <div class="line">true lovers run into strange capers; but as all is</div>
                     <div class="line">mortal in nature, so is all nature in love mortal in folly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou speakest wiser than thou art ware of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I shall ne'er be ware of mine own wit till I</div>
                     <div class="line">break my shins against it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Jove, Jove! this shepherd's passion</div>
                     <div class="line">Is much upon my fashion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">And mine; but it grows something stale with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, one of you question yond man</div>
                     <div class="line">If he for gold will give us any food:</div>
                     <div class="line">I faint almost to death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Holla, you clown!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, fool: he's not thy kinsman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Who calls?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Your betters, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Else are they very wretched.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, I say. Good even to you, friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">And to you, gentle sir, and to you all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, shepherd, if that love or gold</div>
                     <div class="line">Can in this desert place buy entertainment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring us where we may rest ourselves and feed:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a young maid with travel much oppress'd</div>
                     <div class="line">And faints for succor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair sir, I pity her</div>
                     <div class="line">And wish, for her sake more than for mine own,</div>
                     <div class="line">My fortunes were more able to relieve her;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I am shepherd to another man</div>
                     <div class="line">And do not shear the fleeces that I graze:</div>
                     <div class="line">My master is of churlish disposition</div>
                     <div class="line">And little recks to find the way to heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">By doing deeds of hospitality:</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, his cote, his flocks and bounds of feed</div>
                     <div class="line">Are now on sale, and at our sheepcote now,</div>
                     <div class="line">By reason of his absence, there is nothing</div>
                     <div class="line">That you will feed on; but what is, come see.</div>
                     <div class="line">And in my voice most welcome shall you be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">What is he that shall buy his flock and pasture?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">That young swain that you saw here but erewhile,</div>
                     <div class="line">That little cares for buying any thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, if it stand with honesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Buy thou the cottage, pasture and the flock,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt have to pay for it of us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And we will mend thy wages. I like this place.</div>
                     <div class="line">And willingly could waste my time in it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Assuredly the thing is to be sold:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go with me: if you like upon report</div>
                     <div class="line">The soil, the profit and this kind of life,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will your very faithful feeder be</div>
                     <div class="line">And buy it with your gold right suddenly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The Forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AMIENS, JAQUES, and others</p>
               <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the greenwood tree</div>
                     <div class="line">Who loves to lie with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And turn his merry note</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the sweet bird's throat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, come hither, come hither:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here shall he see No enemy</div>
                     <div class="line">But winter and rough weather.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">More, more, I prithee, more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">It will make you melancholy, Monsieur Jaques.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank it. More, I prithee, more. I can suck</div>
                     <div class="line">melancholy out of a song, as a weasel sucks eggs.</div>
                     <div class="line">More, I prithee, more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">My voice is ragged: I know I cannot please you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not desire you to please me; I do desire you to</div>
                     <div class="line">sing. Come, more; another stanzo: call you 'em stanzos?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">What you will, Monsieur Jaques.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I care not for their names; they owe me</div>
                     <div class="line">nothing. Will you sing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">More at your request than to please myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Well then, if ever I thank any man, I'll thank you;</div>
                     <div class="line">but that they call compliment is like the encounter</div>
                     <div class="line">of two dog-apes, and when a man thanks me heartily,</div>
                     <div class="line">methinks I have given him a penny and he renders me</div>
                     <div class="line">the beggarly thanks. Come, sing; and you that will</div>
                     <div class="line">not, hold your tongues.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I'll end the song. Sirs, cover the while; the</div>
                     <div class="line">duke will drink under this tree. He hath been all</div>
                     <div class="line">this day to look you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">And I have been all this day to avoid him. He is</div>
                     <div class="line">too disputable for my company: I think of as many</div>
                     <div class="line">matters as he, but I give heaven thanks and make no</div>
                     <div class="line">boast of them. Come, warble, come.</div>
                     <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
                     <div class="line">Who doth ambition shun</div>
                     <p>All together here</p>
                     <div class="line">And loves to live i' the sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeking the food he eats</div>
                     <div class="line">And pleased with what he gets,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, come hither, come hither:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here shall he see No enemy</div>
                     <div class="line">But winter and rough weather.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give you a verse to this note that I made</div>
                     <div class="line">yesterday in despite of my invention.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll sing it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus it goes:--</div>
                     <div class="line">If it do come to pass</div>
                     <div class="line">That any man turn ass,</div>
                     <div class="line">Leaving his wealth and ease,</div>
                     <div class="line">A stubborn will to please,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ducdame, ducdame, ducdame:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here shall he see</div>
                     <div class="line">Gross fools as he,</div>
                     <div class="line">An if he will come to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that 'ducdame'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis a Greek invocation, to call fools into a</div>
                     <div class="line">circle. I'll go sleep, if I can; if I cannot, I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">rail against all the first-born of Egypt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll go seek the duke: his banquet is prepared.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt severally</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ORLANDO and ADAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear master, I can go no further. O, I die for food!</div>
                     <div class="line">Here lie I down, and measure out my grave. Farewell,</div>
                     <div class="line">kind master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, Adam! no greater heart in thee? Live</div>
                     <div class="line">a little; comfort a little; cheer thyself a little.</div>
                     <div class="line">If this uncouth forest yield any thing savage, I</div>
                     <div class="line">will either be food for it or bring it for food to</div>
                     <div class="line">thee. Thy conceit is nearer death than thy powers.</div>
                     <div class="line">For my sake be comfortable; hold death awhile at</div>
                     <div class="line">the arm's end: I will here be with thee presently;</div>
                     <div class="line">and if I bring thee not something to eat, I will</div>
                     <div class="line">give thee leave to die: but if thou diest before I</div>
                     <div class="line">come, thou art a mocker of my labour. Well said!</div>
                     <div class="line">thou lookest cheerly, and I'll be with thee quickly.</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet thou liest in the bleak air: come, I will bear</div>
                     <div class="line">thee to some shelter; and thou shalt not die for</div>
                     <div class="line">lack of a dinner, if there live any thing in this</div>
                     <div class="line">desert. Cheerly, good Adam!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>A table set out. Enter DUKE SENIOR, AMIENS, and
Lords like outlaws</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I think he be transform'd into a beast;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I can no where find him like a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, he is but even now gone hence:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here was he merry, hearing of a song.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">If he, compact of jars, grow musical,</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall have shortly discord in the spheres.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, seek him: tell him I would speak with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JAQUES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He saves my labour by his own approach.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, monsieur! what a life is this,</div>
                     <div class="line">That your poor friends must woo your company?</div>
                     <div class="line">What, you look merrily!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">A fool, a fool! I met a fool i' the forest,</div>
                     <div class="line">A motley fool; a miserable world!</div>
                     <div class="line">As I do live by food, I met a fool</div>
                     <div class="line">Who laid him down and bask'd him in the sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">And rail'd on Lady Fortune in good terms,</div>
                     <div class="line">In good set terms and yet a motley fool.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Good morrow, fool,' quoth I. 'No, sir,' quoth he,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Call me not fool till heaven hath sent me fortune:'</div>
                     <div class="line">And then he drew a dial from his poke,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, looking on it with lack-lustre eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Says very wisely, 'It is ten o'clock:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus we may see,' quoth he, 'how the world wags:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but an hour ago since it was nine,</div>
                     <div class="line">And after one hour more 'twill be eleven;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, from hour to hour, we ripe and ripe,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then, from hour to hour, we rot and rot;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thereby hangs a tale.' When I did hear</div>
                     <div class="line">The motley fool thus moral on the time,</div>
                     <div class="line">My lungs began to crow like chanticleer,</div>
                     <div class="line">That fools should be so deep-contemplative,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I did laugh sans intermission</div>
                     <div class="line">An hour by his dial. O noble fool!</div>
                     <div class="line">A worthy fool! Motley's the only wear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">What fool is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">O worthy fool! One that hath been a courtier,</div>
                     <div class="line">And says, if ladies be but young and fair,</div>
                     <div class="line">They have the gift to know it: and in his brain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is as dry as the remainder biscuit</div>
                     <div class="line">After a voyage, he hath strange places cramm'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With observation, the which he vents</div>
                     <div class="line">In mangled forms. O that I were a fool!</div>
                     <div class="line">I am ambitious for a motley coat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt have one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">It is my only suit;</div>
                     <div class="line">Provided that you weed your better judgments</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all opinion that grows rank in them</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am wise. I must have liberty</div>
                     <div class="line">Withal, as large a charter as the wind,</div>
                     <div class="line">To blow on whom I please; for so fools have;</div>
                     <div class="line">And they that are most galled with my folly,</div>
                     <div class="line">They most must laugh. And why, sir, must they so?</div>
                     <div class="line">The 'why' is plain as way to parish church:</div>
                     <div class="line">He that a fool doth very wisely hit</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth very foolishly, although he smart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to seem senseless of the bob: if not,</div>
                     <div class="line">The wise man's folly is anatomized</div>
                     <div class="line">Even by the squandering glances of the fool.</div>
                     <div class="line">Invest me in my motley; give me leave</div>
                     <div class="line">To speak my mind, and I will through and through</div>
                     <div class="line">Cleanse the foul body of the infected world,</div>
                     <div class="line">If they will patiently receive my medicine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie on thee! I can tell what thou wouldst do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">What, for a counter, would I do but good?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Most mischievous foul sin, in chiding sin:</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou thyself hast been a libertine,</div>
                     <div class="line">As sensual as the brutish sting itself;</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the embossed sores and headed evils,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou with licence of free foot hast caught,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wouldst thou disgorge into the general world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, who cries out on pride,</div>
                     <div class="line">That can therein tax any private party?</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth it not flow as hugely as the sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till that the weary very means do ebb?</div>
                     <div class="line">What woman in the city do I name,</div>
                     <div class="line">When that I say the city-woman bears</div>
                     <div class="line">The cost of princes on unworthy shoulders?</div>
                     <div class="line">Who can come in and say that I mean her,</div>
                     <div class="line">When such a one as she such is her neighbour?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or what is he of basest function</div>
                     <div class="line">That says his bravery is not of my cost,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thinking that I mean him, but therein suits</div>
                     <div class="line">His folly to the mettle of my speech?</div>
                     <div class="line">There then; how then? what then? Let me see wherein</div>
                     <div class="line">My tongue hath wrong'd him: if it do him right,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then he hath wrong'd himself; if he be free,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then my taxing like a wild-goose flies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unclaim'd of any man. But who comes here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ORLANDO, with his sword drawn</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Forbear, and eat no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, I have eat none yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor shalt not, till necessity be served.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what kind should this cock come of?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou thus bolden'd, man, by thy distress,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else a rude despiser of good manners,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in civility thou seem'st so empty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">You touch'd my vein at first: the thorny point</div>
                     <div class="line">Of bare distress hath ta'en from me the show</div>
                     <div class="line">Of smooth civility: yet am I inland bred</div>
                     <div class="line">And know some nurture. But forbear, I say:</div>
                     <div class="line">He dies that touches any of this fruit</div>
                     <div class="line">Till I and my affairs are answered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">An you will not be answered with reason, I must die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">What would you have? Your gentleness shall force</div>
                     <div class="line">More than your force move us to gentleness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I almost die for food; and let me have it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Sit down and feed, and welcome to our table.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak you so gently? Pardon me, I pray you:</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought that all things had been savage here;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore put I on the countenance</div>
                     <div class="line">Of stern commandment. But whate'er you are</div>
                     <div class="line">That in this desert inaccessible,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the shade of melancholy boughs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lose and neglect the creeping hours of time</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever you have look'd on better days,</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever been where bells have knoll'd to church,</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever sat at any good man's feast,</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever from your eyelids wiped a tear</div>
                     <div class="line">And know what 'tis to pity and be pitied,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let gentleness my strong enforcement be:</div>
                     <div class="line">In the which hope I blush, and hide my sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">True is it that we have seen better days,</div>
                     <div class="line">And have with holy bell been knoll'd to church</div>
                     <div class="line">And sat at good men's feasts and wiped our eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">Of drops that sacred pity hath engender'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore sit you down in gentleness</div>
                     <div class="line">And take upon command what help we have</div>
                     <div class="line">That to your wanting may be minister'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Then but forbear your food a little while,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles, like a doe, I go to find my fawn</div>
                     <div class="line">And give it food. There is an old poor man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who after me hath many a weary step</div>
                     <div class="line">Limp'd in pure love: till he be first sufficed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Oppress'd with two weak evils, age and hunger,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not touch a bit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Go find him out,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we will nothing waste till you return.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank ye; and be blest for your good comfort!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou seest we are not all alone unhappy:</div>
                     <div class="line">This wide and universal theatre</div>
                     <div class="line">Presents more woeful pageants than the scene</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein we play in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">All the world's a stage,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the men and women merely players:</div>
                     <div class="line">They have their exits and their entrances;</div>
                     <div class="line">And one man in his time plays many parts,</div>
