                     <div class="line">His acts being seven ages. At first the infant,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mewling and puking in the nurse's arms.</div>
                     <div class="line">And then the whining school-boy, with his satchel</div>
                     <div class="line">And shining morning face, creeping like snail</div>
                     <div class="line">Unwillingly to school. And then the lover,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sighing like furnace, with a woeful ballad</div>
                     <div class="line">Made to his mistress' eyebrow. Then a soldier,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of strange oaths and bearded like the pard,</div>
                     <div class="line">Jealous in honour, sudden and quick in quarrel,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeking the bubble reputation</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the cannon's mouth. And then the justice,</div>
                     <div class="line">In fair round belly with good capon lined,</div>
                     <div class="line">With eyes severe and beard of formal cut,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of wise saws and modern instances;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so he plays his part. The sixth age shifts</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the lean and slipper'd pantaloon,</div>
                     <div class="line">With spectacles on nose and pouch on side,</div>
                     <div class="line">His youthful hose, well saved, a world too wide</div>
                     <div class="line">For his shrunk shank; and his big manly voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turning again toward childish treble, pipes</div>
                     <div class="line">And whistles in his sound. Last scene of all,</div>
                     <div class="line">That ends this strange eventful history,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is second childishness and mere oblivion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sans teeth, sans eyes, sans taste, sans everything.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter ORLANDO, with ADAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome. Set down your venerable burthen,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let him feed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you most for him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADAM</div>
                     <div class="line">So had you need:</div>
                     <div class="line">I scarce can speak to thank you for myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome; fall to: I will not trouble you</div>
                     <div class="line">As yet, to question you about your fortunes.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give us some music; and, good cousin, sing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AMIENS</div>
                     <div class="line">Blow, blow, thou winter wind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art not so unkind</div>
                     <div class="line">As man's ingratitude;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy tooth is not so keen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because thou art not seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although thy breath be rude.</div>
                     <div class="line">Heigh-ho! sing, heigh-ho! unto the green holly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Most friendship is feigning, most loving mere folly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, heigh-ho, the holly!</div>
                     <div class="line">This life is most jolly.</div>
                     <div class="line">Freeze, freeze, thou bitter sky,</div>
                     <div class="line">That dost not bite so nigh</div>
                     <div class="line">As benefits forgot:</div>
                     <div class="line">Though thou the waters warp,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy sting is not so sharp</div>
                     <div class="line">As friend remember'd not.</div>
                     <div class="line">Heigh-ho! sing, &c.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">If that you were the good Sir Rowland's son,</div>
                     <div class="line">As you have whisper'd faithfully you were,</div>
                     <div class="line">And as mine eye doth his effigies witness</div>
                     <div class="line">Most truly limn'd and living in your face,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be truly welcome hither: I am the duke</div>
                     <div class="line">That loved your father: the residue of your fortune,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to my cave and tell me. Good old man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art right welcome as thy master is.</div>
                     <div class="line">Support him by the arm. Give me your hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let me all your fortunes understand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  A room in the palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.6">5. SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A room in the palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE FREDERICK, Lords, and OLIVER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Not see him since? Sir, sir, that cannot be:</div>
                     <div class="line">But were I not the better part made mercy,</div>
                     <div class="line">I should not seek an absent argument</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my revenge, thou present. But look to it:</div>
                     <div class="line">Find out thy brother, wheresoe'er he is;</div>
                     <div class="line">Seek him with candle; bring him dead or living</div>
                     <div class="line">Within this twelvemonth, or turn thou no more</div>
                     <div class="line">To seek a living in our territory.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy lands and all things that thou dost call thine</div>
                     <div class="line">Worth seizure do we seize into our hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till thou canst quit thee by thy brothers mouth</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what we think against thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">O that your highness knew my heart in this!</div>
                     <div class="line">I never loved my brother in my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE FREDERICK</div>
                     <div class="line">More villain thou. Well, push him out of doors;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let my officers of such a nature</div>
                     <div class="line">Make an extent upon his house and lands:</div>
                     <div class="line">Do this expediently and turn him going.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ORLANDO, with a paper</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang there, my verse, in witness of my love:</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou, thrice-crowned queen of night, survey</div>
                     <div class="line">With thy chaste eye, from thy pale sphere above,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy huntress' name that my full life doth sway.</div>
                     <div class="line">O Rosalind! these trees shall be my books</div>
                     <div class="line">And in their barks my thoughts I'll character;</div>
                     <div class="line">That every eye which in this forest looks</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall see thy virtue witness'd every where.</div>
                     <div class="line">Run, run, Orlando; carve on every tree</div>
                     <div class="line">The fair, the chaste and unexpressive she.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter CORIN and TOUCHSTONE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">And how like you this shepherd's life, Master Touchstone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, shepherd, in respect of itself, it is a good</div>
                     <div class="line">life, but in respect that it is a shepherd's life,</div>
                     <div class="line">it is naught. In respect that it is solitary, I</div>
                     <div class="line">like it very well; but in respect that it is</div>
                     <div class="line">private, it is a very vile life. Now, in respect it</div>
                     <div class="line">is in the fields, it pleaseth me well; but in</div>
                     <div class="line">respect it is not in the court, it is tedious. As</div>
                     <div class="line">is it a spare life, look you, it fits my humour well;</div>
                     <div class="line">but as there is no more plenty in it, it goes much</div>
                     <div class="line">against my stomach. Hast any philosophy in thee, shepherd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">No more but that I know the more one sickens the</div>
                     <div class="line">worse at ease he is; and that he that wants money,</div>
                     <div class="line">means and content is without three good friends;</div>
                     <div class="line">that the property of rain is to wet and fire to</div>
                     <div class="line">burn; that good pasture makes fat sheep, and that a</div>
                     <div class="line">great cause of the night is lack of the sun; that</div>
                     <div class="line">he that hath learned no wit by nature nor art may</div>
                     <div class="line">complain of good breeding or comes of a very dull kindred.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Such a one is a natural philosopher. Wast ever in</div>
                     <div class="line">court, shepherd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">No, truly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then thou art damned.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I hope.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, thou art damned like an ill-roasted egg, all</div>
                     <div class="line">on one side.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">For not being at court? Your reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, if thou never wast at court, thou never sawest</div>
                     <div class="line">good manners; if thou never sawest good manners,</div>
                     <div class="line">then thy manners must be wicked; and wickedness is</div>
                     <div class="line">sin, and sin is damnation. Thou art in a parlous</div>
                     <div class="line">state, shepherd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a whit, Touchstone: those that are good manners</div>
                     <div class="line">at the court are as ridiculous in the country as the</div>
                     <div class="line">behavior of the country is most mockable at the</div>
                     <div class="line">court. You told me you salute not at the court, but</div>
                     <div class="line">you kiss your hands: that courtesy would be</div>
                     <div class="line">uncleanly, if courtiers were shepherds.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Instance, briefly; come, instance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, we are still handling our ewes, and their</div>
                     <div class="line">fells, you know, are greasy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, do not your courtier's hands sweat? and is not</div>
                     <div class="line">the grease of a mutton as wholesome as the sweat of</div>
                     <div class="line">a man? Shallow, shallow. A better instance, I say; come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, our hands are hard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Your lips will feel them the sooner. Shallow again.</div>
                     <div class="line">A more sounder instance, come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">And they are often tarred over with the surgery of</div>
                     <div class="line">our sheep: and would you have us kiss tar? The</div>
                     <div class="line">courtier's hands are perfumed with civet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Most shallow man! thou worms-meat, in respect of a</div>
                     <div class="line">good piece of flesh indeed! Learn of the wise, and</div>
                     <div class="line">perpend: civet is of a baser birth than tar, the</div>
                     <div class="line">very uncleanly flux of a cat. Mend the instance, shepherd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">You have too courtly a wit for me: I'll rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou rest damned? God help thee, shallow man!</div>
                     <div class="line">God make incision in thee! thou art raw.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I am a true labourer: I earn that I eat, get</div>
                     <div class="line">that I wear, owe no man hate, envy no man's</div>
                     <div class="line">happiness, glad of other men's good, content with my</div>
                     <div class="line">harm, and the greatest of my pride is to see my ewes</div>
                     <div class="line">graze and my lambs suck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">That is another simple sin in you, to bring the ewes</div>
                     <div class="line">and the rams together and to offer to get your</div>
                     <div class="line">living by the copulation of cattle; to be bawd to a</div>
                     <div class="line">bell-wether, and to betray a she-lamb of a</div>
                     <div class="line">twelvemonth to a crooked-pated, old, cuckoldly ram,</div>
                     <div class="line">out of all reasonable match. If thou beest not</div>
                     <div class="line">damned for this, the devil himself will have no</div>
                     <div class="line">shepherds; I cannot see else how thou shouldst</div>
                     <div class="line">'scape.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes young Master Ganymede, my new mistress's brother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSALIND, with a paper, reading</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">From the east to western Ind,</div>
                     <div class="line">No jewel is like Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Her worth, being mounted on the wind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through all the world bears Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">All the pictures fairest lined</div>
                     <div class="line">Are but black to Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let no fair be kept in mind</div>
                     <div class="line">But the fair of Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll rhyme you so eight years together, dinners and</div>
                     <div class="line">suppers and sleeping-hours excepted: it is the</div>
                     <div class="line">right butter-women's rank to market.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, fool!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">For a taste:</div>
                     <div class="line">If a hart do lack a hind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him seek out Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">If the cat will after kind,</div>
                     <div class="line">So be sure will Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Winter garments must be lined,</div>
                     <div class="line">So must slender Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">They that reap must sheaf and bind;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then to cart with Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweetest nut hath sourest rind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such a nut is Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">He that sweetest rose will find</div>
                     <div class="line">Must find love's prick and Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the very false gallop of verses: why do you</div>
                     <div class="line">infect yourself with them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, you dull fool! I found them on a tree.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, the tree yields bad fruit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll graff it with you, and then I shall graff it</div>
                     <div class="line">with a medlar: then it will be the earliest fruit</div>
                     <div class="line">i' the country; for you'll be rotten ere you be half</div>
                     <div class="line">ripe, and that's the right virtue of the medlar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">You have said; but whether wisely or no, let the</div>
                     <div class="line">forest judge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CELIA, with a writing</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace! Here comes my sister, reading: stand aside.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">Why should this a desert be?</div>
                     <div class="line">For it is unpeopled? No:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tongues I'll hang on every tree,</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall civil sayings show:</div>
                     <div class="line">Some, how brief the life of man</div>
                     <div class="line">Runs his erring pilgrimage,</div>
                     <div class="line">That the stretching of a span</div>
                     <div class="line">Buckles in his sum of age;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some, of violated vows</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twixt the souls of friend and friend:</div>
                     <div class="line">But upon the fairest boughs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or at every sentence end,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I Rosalinda write,</div>
                     <div class="line">Teaching all that read to know</div>
                     <div class="line">The quintessence of every sprite</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven would in little show.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore Heaven Nature charged</div>
                     <div class="line">That one body should be fill'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With all graces wide-enlarged:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nature presently distill'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Helen's cheek, but not her heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cleopatra's majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Atalanta's better part,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sad Lucretia's modesty.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus Rosalind of many parts</div>
                     <div class="line">By heavenly synod was devised,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of many faces, eyes and hearts,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have the touches dearest prized.</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven would that she these gifts should have,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I to live and die her slave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">O most gentle pulpiter! what tedious homily of love</div>
                     <div class="line">have you wearied your parishioners withal, and never</div>
                     <div class="line">cried 'Have patience, good people!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! back, friends! Shepherd, go off a little.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go with him, sirrah.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, shepherd, let us make an honourable retreat;</div>
                     <div class="line">though not with bag and baggage, yet with scrip and scrippage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt CORIN and TOUCHSTONE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou hear these verses?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">O, yes, I heard them all, and more too; for some of</div>
                     <div class="line">them had in them more feet than the verses would bear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That's no matter: the feet might bear the verses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but the feet were lame and could not bear</div>
                     <div class="line">themselves without the verse and therefore stood</div>
                     <div class="line">lamely in the verse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">But didst thou hear without wondering how thy name</div>
                     <div class="line">should be hanged and carved upon these trees?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I was seven of the nine days out of the wonder</div>
                     <div class="line">before you came; for look here what I found on a</div>
                     <div class="line">palm-tree. I was never so be-rhymed since</div>
                     <div class="line">Pythagoras' time, that I was an Irish rat, which I</div>
                     <div class="line">can hardly remember.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Trow you who hath done this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it a man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And a chain, that you once wore, about his neck.</div>
                     <div class="line">Change you colour?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, who?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, Lord! it is a hard matter for friends to</div>
                     <div class="line">meet; but mountains may be removed with earthquakes</div>
                     <div class="line">and so encounter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but who is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it possible?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I prithee now with most petitionary vehemence,</div>
                     <div class="line">tell me who it is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O wonderful, wonderful, and most wonderful</div>
                     <div class="line">wonderful! and yet again wonderful, and after that,</div>
                     <div class="line">out of all hooping!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my complexion! dost thou think, though I am</div>
                     <div class="line">caparisoned like a man, I have a doublet and hose in</div>
                     <div class="line">my disposition? One inch of delay more is a</div>
                     <div class="line">South-sea of discovery; I prithee, tell me who is it</div>
                     <div class="line">quickly, and speak apace. I would thou couldst</div>
                     <div class="line">stammer, that thou mightst pour this concealed man</div>
                     <div class="line">out of thy mouth, as wine comes out of a narrow-</div>
                     <div class="line">mouthed bottle, either too much at once, or none at</div>
                     <div class="line">all. I prithee, take the cork out of thy mouth that</div>
                     <div class="line">may drink thy tidings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">So you may put a man in your belly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Is he of God's making? What manner of man? Is his</div>
                     <div class="line">head worth a hat, or his chin worth a beard?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, he hath but a little beard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, God will send more, if the man will be</div>
                     <div class="line">thankful: let me stay the growth of his beard, if</div>
                     <div class="line">thou delay me not the knowledge of his chin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">It is young Orlando, that tripped up the wrestler's</div>
                     <div class="line">heels and your heart both in an instant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but the devil take mocking: speak, sad brow and</div>
                     <div class="line">true maid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I' faith, coz, 'tis he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Orlando?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Orlando.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas the day! what shall I do with my doublet and</div>
                     <div class="line">hose? What did he when thou sawest him? What said</div>
                     <div class="line">he? How looked he? Wherein went he? What makes</div>
                     <div class="line">him here? Did he ask for me? Where remains he?</div>
                     <div class="line">How parted he with thee? and when shalt thou see</div>
                     <div class="line">him again? Answer me in one word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You must borrow me Gargantua's mouth first: 'tis a</div>
                     <div class="line">word too great for any mouth of this age's size. To</div>
                     <div class="line">say ay and no to these particulars is more than to</div>
                     <div class="line">answer in a catechism.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">But doth he know that I am in this forest and in</div>
                     <div class="line">man's apparel? Looks he as freshly as he did the</div>
                     <div class="line">day he wrestled?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">It is as easy to count atomies as to resolve the</div>
                     <div class="line">propositions of a lover; but take a taste of my</div>
                     <div class="line">finding him, and relish it with good observance.</div>
                     <div class="line">I found him under a tree, like a dropped acorn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">It may well be called Jove's tree, when it drops</div>
                     <div class="line">forth such fruit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me audience, good madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Proceed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">There lay he, stretched along, like a wounded knight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Though it be pity to see such a sight, it well</div>
                     <div class="line">becomes the ground.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry 'holla' to thy tongue, I prithee; it curvets</div>
                     <div class="line">unseasonably. He was furnished like a hunter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">O, ominous! he comes to kill my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I would sing my song without a burden: thou bringest</div>
                     <div class="line">me out of tune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you not know I am a woman? when I think, I must</div>
                     <div class="line">speak. Sweet, say on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You bring me out. Soft! comes he not here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ORLANDO and JAQUES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis he: slink by, and note him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you for your company; but, good faith, I had</div>
                     <div class="line">as lief have been myself alone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">And so had I; but yet, for fashion sake, I thank you</div>
                     <div class="line">too for your society.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">God be wi' you: let's meet as little as we can.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I do desire we may be better strangers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, mar no more trees with writing</div>
                     <div class="line">love-songs in their barks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, mar no more of my verses with reading</div>
                     <div class="line">them ill-favouredly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Rosalind is your love's name?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, just.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not like her name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">There was no thought of pleasing you when she was</div>
                     <div class="line">christened.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">What stature is she of?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Just as high as my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">You are full of pretty answers. Have you not been</div>
                     <div class="line">acquainted with goldsmiths' wives, and conned them</div>
                     <div class="line">out of rings?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so; but I answer you right painted cloth, from</div>
                     <div class="line">whence you have studied your questions.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">You have a nimble wit: I think 'twas made of</div>
                     <div class="line">Atalanta's heels. Will you sit down with me? and</div>
                     <div class="line">we two will rail against our mistress the world and</div>
                     <div class="line">all our misery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will chide no breather in the world but myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">against whom I know most faults.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">The worst fault you have is to be in love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis a fault I will not change for your best virtue.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am weary of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, I was seeking for a fool when I found</div>
                     <div class="line">you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">He is drowned in the brook: look but in, and you</div>
                     <div class="line">shall see him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">There I shall see mine own figure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I take to be either a fool or a cipher.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tarry no longer with you: farewell, good</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad of your departure: adieu, good Monsieur</div>
                     <div class="line">Melancholy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit JAQUES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to CELIA</span>  I will speak to him, like a saucy</div>
                     <div class="line">lackey and under that habit play the knave with him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you hear, forester?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Very well: what would you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, what is't o'clock?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">You should ask me what time o' day: there's no clock</div>
                     <div class="line">in the forest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Then there is no true lover in the forest; else</div>
                     <div class="line">sighing every minute and groaning every hour would</div>
                     <div class="line">detect the lazy foot of Time as well as a clock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">And why not the swift foot of Time? had not that</div>
                     <div class="line">been as proper?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">By no means, sir: Time travels in divers paces with</div>
                     <div class="line">divers persons. I'll tell you who Time ambles</div>
                     <div class="line">withal, who Time trots withal, who Time gallops</div>
                     <div class="line">withal and who he stands still withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, who doth he trot withal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, he trots hard with a young maid between the</div>
                     <div class="line">contract of her marriage and the day it is</div>
                     <div class="line">solemnized: if the interim be but a se'nnight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Time's pace is so hard that it seems the length of</div>
                     <div class="line">seven year.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who ambles Time withal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">With a priest that lacks Latin and a rich man that</div>
                     <div class="line">hath not the gout, for the one sleeps easily because</div>
                     <div class="line">he cannot study, and the other lives merrily because</div>
                     <div class="line">he feels no pain, the one lacking the burden of lean</div>
                     <div class="line">and wasteful learning, the other knowing no burden</div>
                     <div class="line">of heavy tedious penury; these Time ambles withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who doth he gallop withal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">With a thief to the gallows, for though he go as</div>
                     <div class="line">softly as foot can fall, he thinks himself too soon there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who stays it still withal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">With lawyers in the vacation, for they sleep between</div>
                     <div class="line">term and term and then they perceive not how Time moves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Where dwell you, pretty youth?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">With this shepherdess, my sister; here in the</div>
                     <div class="line">skirts of the forest, like fringe upon a petticoat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you native of this place?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">As the cony that you see dwell where she is kindled.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Your accent is something finer than you could</div>
                     <div class="line">purchase in so removed a dwelling.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been told so of many: but indeed an old</div>
                     <div class="line">religious uncle of mine taught me to speak, who was</div>
                     <div class="line">in his youth an inland man; one that knew courtship</div>
                     <div class="line">too well, for there he fell in love. I have heard</div>
                     <div class="line">him read many lectures against it, and I thank God</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not a woman, to be touched with so many</div>
                     <div class="line">giddy offences as he hath generally taxed their</div>
                     <div class="line">whole sex withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you remember any of the principal evils that he</div>
                     <div class="line">laid to the charge of women?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">There were none principal; they were all like one</div>
                     <div class="line">another as half-pence are, every one fault seeming</div>
                     <div class="line">monstrous till his fellow fault came to match it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, recount some of them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I will not cast away my physic but on those that</div>
                     <div class="line">are sick. There is a man haunts the forest, that</div>
                     <div class="line">abuses our young plants with carving 'Rosalind' on</div>
                     <div class="line">their barks; hangs odes upon hawthorns and elegies</div>
                     <div class="line">on brambles, all, forsooth, deifying the name of</div>
                     <div class="line">Rosalind: if I could meet that fancy-monger I would</div>
                     <div class="line">give him some good counsel, for he seems to have the</div>
                     <div class="line">quotidian of love upon him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am he that is so love-shaked: I pray you tell me</div>
                     <div class="line">your remedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">There is none of my uncle's marks upon you: he</div>
                     <div class="line">taught me how to know a man in love; in which cage</div>
                     <div class="line">of rushes I am sure you are not prisoner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">What were his marks?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">A lean cheek, which you have not, a blue eye and</div>
                     <div class="line">sunken, which you have not, an unquestionable</div>
                     <div class="line">spirit, which you have not, a beard neglected,</div>
                     <div class="line">which you have not; but I pardon you for that, for</div>
                     <div class="line">simply your having in beard is a younger brother's</div>
                     <div class="line">revenue: then your hose should be ungartered, your</div>
                     <div class="line">bonnet unbanded, your sleeve unbuttoned, your shoe</div>
                     <div class="line">untied and every thing about you demonstrating a</div>
                     <div class="line">careless desolation; but you are no such man; you</div>
                     <div class="line">are rather point-device in your accoutrements as</div>
                     <div class="line">loving yourself than seeming the lover of any other.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair youth, I would I could make thee believe I love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Me believe it! you may as soon make her that you</div>
                     <div class="line">love believe it; which, I warrant, she is apter to</div>
                     <div class="line">do than to confess she does: that is one of the</div>
                     <div class="line">points in the which women still give the lie to</div>
                     <div class="line">their consciences. But, in good sooth, are you he</div>
                     <div class="line">that hangs the verses on the trees, wherein Rosalind</div>
                     <div class="line">is so admired?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I swear to thee, youth, by the white hand of</div>
                     <div class="line">Rosalind, I am that he, that unfortunate he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">But are you so much in love as your rhymes speak?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither rhyme nor reason can express how much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Love is merely a madness, and, I tell you, deserves</div>
                     <div class="line">as well a dark house and a whip as madmen do: and</div>
                     <div class="line">the reason why they are not so punished and cured</div>
                     <div class="line">is, that the lunacy is so ordinary that the whippers</div>
                     <div class="line">are in love too. Yet I profess curing it by counsel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Did you ever cure any so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, one, and in this manner. He was to imagine me</div>
                     <div class="line">his love, his mistress; and I set him every day to</div>
                     <div class="line">woo me: at which time would I, being but a moonish</div>
                     <div class="line">youth, grieve, be effeminate, changeable, longing</div>
                     <div class="line">and liking, proud, fantastical, apish, shallow,</div>
                     <div class="line">inconstant, full of tears, full of smiles, for every</div>
                     <div class="line">passion something and for no passion truly any</div>
                     <div class="line">thing, as boys and women are for the most part</div>
                     <div class="line">cattle of this colour; would now like him, now loathe</div>
                     <div class="line">him; then entertain him, then forswear him; now weep</div>
                     <div class="line">for him, then spit at him; that I drave my suitor</div>
                     <div class="line">from his mad humour of love to a living humour of</div>
                     <div class="line">madness; which was, to forswear the full stream of</div>
                     <div class="line">the world, and to live in a nook merely monastic.</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus I cured him; and this way will I take upon</div>
                     <div class="line">me to wash your liver as clean as a sound sheep's</div>
                     <div class="line">heart, that there shall not be one spot of love in't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not be cured, youth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I would cure you, if you would but call me Rosalind</div>
                     <div class="line">and come every day to my cote and woo me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by the faith of my love, I will: tell me</div>
                     <div class="line">where it is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Go with me to it and I'll show it you and by the way</div>
                     <div class="line">you shall tell me where in the forest you live.</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my heart, good youth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay you must call me Rosalind. Come, sister, will you go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY; JAQUES behind</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come apace, good Audrey: I will fetch up your</div>
                     <div class="line">goats, Audrey. And how, Audrey? am I the man yet?</div>
                     <div class="line">doth my simple feature content you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Your features! Lord warrant us! what features!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am here with thee and thy goats, as the most</div>
                     <div class="line">capricious poet, honest Ovid, was among the Goths.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  O knowledge ill-inhabited, worse than Jove</div>
                     <div class="line">in a thatched house!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">When a man's verses cannot be understood, nor a</div>
                     <div class="line">man's good wit seconded with the forward child</div>
                     <div class="line">Understanding, it strikes a man more dead than a</div>
                     <div class="line">great reckoning in a little room. Truly, I would</div>
                     <div class="line">the gods had made thee poetical.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not know what 'poetical' is: is it honest in</div>
                     <div class="line">deed and word? is it a true thing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, truly; for the truest poetry is the most</div>
                     <div class="line">feigning; and lovers are given to poetry, and what</div>
                     <div class="line">they swear in poetry may be said as lovers they do feign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you wish then that the gods had made me poetical?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">I do, truly; for thou swearest to me thou art</div>
                     <div class="line">honest: now, if thou wert a poet, I might have some</div>
                     <div class="line">hope thou didst feign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Would you not have me honest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, truly, unless thou wert hard-favoured; for</div>
                     <div class="line">honesty coupled to beauty is to have honey a sauce to sugar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  A material fool!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I am not fair; and therefore I pray the gods</div>
                     <div class="line">make me honest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, and to cast away honesty upon a foul slut</div>
                     <div class="line">were to put good meat into an unclean dish.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not a slut, though I thank the gods I am foul.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, praised be the gods for thy foulness!</div>
                     <div class="line">sluttishness may come hereafter. But be it as it may</div>
                     <div class="line">be, I will marry thee, and to that end I have been</div>
                     <div class="line">with Sir Oliver Martext, the vicar of the next</div>
                     <div class="line">village, who hath promised to meet me in this place</div>
                     <div class="line">of the forest and to couple us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I would fain see this meeting.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, the gods give us joy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen. A man may, if he were of a fearful heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">stagger in this attempt; for here we have no temple</div>
                     <div class="line">but the wood, no assembly but horn-beasts. But what</div>
                     <div class="line">though? Courage! As horns are odious, they are</div>
                     <div class="line">necessary. It is said, 'many a man knows no end of</div>
