                     <div class="line">his goods:' right; many a man has good horns, and</div>
                     <div class="line">knows no end of them. Well, that is the dowry of</div>
                     <div class="line">his wife; 'tis none of his own getting. Horns?</div>
                     <div class="line">Even so. Poor men alone? No, no; the noblest deer</div>
                     <div class="line">hath them as huge as the rascal. Is the single man</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore blessed? No: as a walled town is more</div>
                     <div class="line">worthier than a village, so is the forehead of a</div>
                     <div class="line">married man more honourable than the bare brow of a</div>
                     <div class="line">bachelor; and by how much defence is better than no</div>
                     <div class="line">skill, by so much is a horn more precious than to</div>
                     <div class="line">want. Here comes Sir Oliver.</div>
                     <p>Enter SIR OLIVER MARTEXT</p>
                     <div class="line">Sir Oliver Martext, you are well met: will you</div>
                     <div class="line">dispatch us here under this tree, or shall we go</div>
                     <div class="line">with you to your chapel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR OLIVER MARTEXT</div>
                     <div class="line">Is there none here to give the woman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not take her on gift of any man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR OLIVER MARTEXT</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, she must be given, or the marriage is not lawful.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Advancing</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">Proceed, proceed I'll give her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good even, good Master What-ye-call't: how do you,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir? You are very well met: God 'ild you for your</div>
                     <div class="line">last company: I am very glad to see you: even a</div>
                     <div class="line">toy in hand here, sir: nay, pray be covered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you be married, motley?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">As the ox hath his bow, sir, the horse his curb and</div>
                     <div class="line">the falcon her bells, so man hath his desires; and</div>
                     <div class="line">as pigeons bill, so wedlock would be nibbling.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">And will you, being a man of your breeding, be</div>
                     <div class="line">married under a bush like a beggar? Get you to</div>
                     <div class="line">church, and have a good priest that can tell you</div>
                     <div class="line">what marriage is: this fellow will but join you</div>
                     <div class="line">together as they join wainscot; then one of you will</div>
                     <div class="line">prove a shrunk panel and, like green timber, warp, warp.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I am not in the mind but I were better to be</div>
                     <div class="line">married of him than of another: for he is not like</div>
                     <div class="line">to marry me well; and not being well married, it</div>
                     <div class="line">will be a good excuse for me hereafter to leave my wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Go thou with me, and let me counsel thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">'Come, sweet Audrey:</div>
                     <div class="line">We must be married, or we must live in bawdry.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, good Master Oliver: not,--</div>
                     <div class="line">O sweet Oliver,</div>
                     <div class="line">O brave Oliver,</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave me not behind thee: but,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Wind away,</div>
                     <div class="line">Begone, I say,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not to wedding with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt JAQUES, TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR OLIVER MARTEXT</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis no matter: ne'er a fantastical knave of them</div>
                     <div class="line">all shall flout me out of my calling.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSALIND and CELIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Never talk to me; I will weep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, I prithee; but yet have the grace to consider</div>
                     <div class="line">that tears do not become a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">But have I not cause to weep?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">As good cause as one would desire; therefore weep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">His very hair is of the dissembling colour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Something browner than Judas's marry, his kisses are</div>
                     <div class="line">Judas's own children.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I' faith, his hair is of a good colour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">An excellent colour: your chestnut was ever the only colour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">And his kissing is as full of sanctity as the touch</div>
                     <div class="line">of holy bread.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath bought a pair of cast lips of Diana: a nun</div>
                     <div class="line">of winter's sisterhood kisses not more religiously;</div>
                     <div class="line">the very ice of chastity is in them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">But why did he swear he would come this morning, and</div>
                     <div class="line">comes not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, certainly, there is no truth in him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you think so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes; I think he is not a pick-purse nor a</div>
                     <div class="line">horse-stealer, but for his verity in love, I do</div>
                     <div class="line">think him as concave as a covered goblet or a</div>
                     <div class="line">worm-eaten nut.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Not true in love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, when he is in; but I think he is not in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">You have heard him swear downright he was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Was' is not 'is:' besides, the oath of a lover is</div>
                     <div class="line">no stronger than the word of a tapster; they are</div>
                     <div class="line">both the confirmer of false reckonings. He attends</div>
                     <div class="line">here in the forest on the duke your father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I met the duke yesterday and had much question with</div>
                     <div class="line">him: he asked me of what parentage I was; I told</div>
                     <div class="line">him, of as good as he; so he laughed and let me go.</div>
                     <div class="line">But what talk we of fathers, when there is such a</div>
                     <div class="line">man as Orlando?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that's a brave man! he writes brave verses,</div>
                     <div class="line">speaks brave words, swears brave oaths and breaks</div>
                     <div class="line">them bravely, quite traverse, athwart the heart of</div>
                     <div class="line">his lover; as a puisny tilter, that spurs his horse</div>
                     <div class="line">but on one side, breaks his staff like a noble</div>
                     <div class="line">goose: but all's brave that youth mounts and folly</div>
                     <div class="line">guides. Who comes here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CORIN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Mistress and master, you have oft inquired</div>
                     <div class="line">After the shepherd that complain'd of love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who you saw sitting by me on the turf,</div>
                     <div class="line">Praising the proud disdainful shepherdess</div>
                     <div class="line">That was his mistress.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, and what of him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">If you will see a pageant truly play'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Between the pale complexion of true love</div>
                     <div class="line">And the red glow of scorn and proud disdain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go hence a little and I shall conduct you,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you will mark it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">O, come, let us remove:</div>
                     <div class="line">The sight of lovers feedeth those in love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring us to this sight, and you shall say</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll prove a busy actor in their play.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SILVIUS and PHEBE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Phebe, do not scorn me; do not, Phebe;</div>
                     <div class="line">Say that you love me not, but say not so</div>
                     <div class="line">In bitterness. The common executioner,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose heart the accustom'd sight of death makes hard,</div>
                     <div class="line">Falls not the axe upon the humbled neck</div>
                     <div class="line">But first begs pardon: will you sterner be</div>
                     <div class="line">Than he that dies and lives by bloody drops?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSALIND, CELIA, and CORIN, behind</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not be thy executioner:</div>
                     <div class="line">I fly thee, for I would not injure thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou tell'st me there is murder in mine eye:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis pretty, sure, and very probable,</div>
                     <div class="line">That eyes, that are the frail'st and softest things,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who shut their coward gates on atomies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should be call'd tyrants, butchers, murderers!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now I do frown on thee with all my heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">And if mine eyes can wound, now let them kill thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now counterfeit to swoon; why now fall down;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if thou canst not, O, for shame, for shame,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lie not, to say mine eyes are murderers!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now show the wound mine eye hath made in thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Scratch thee but with a pin, and there remains</div>
                     <div class="line">Some scar of it; lean but upon a rush,</div>
                     <div class="line">The cicatrice and capable impressure</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy palm some moment keeps; but now mine eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I have darted at thee, hurt thee not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor, I am sure, there is no force in eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">That can do hurt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O dear Phebe,</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever,--as that ever may be near,--</div>
                     <div class="line">You meet in some fresh cheek the power of fancy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then shall you know the wounds invisible</div>
                     <div class="line">That love's keen arrows make.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">But till that time</div>
                     <div class="line">Come not thou near me: and when that time comes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Afflict me with thy mocks, pity me not;</div>
                     <div class="line">As till that time I shall not pity thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">And why, I pray you? Who might be your mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you insult, exult, and all at once,</div>
                     <div class="line">Over the wretched? What though you have no beauty,--</div>
                     <div class="line">As, by my faith, I see no more in you</div>
                     <div class="line">Than without candle may go dark to bed--</div>
                     <div class="line">Must you be therefore proud and pitiless?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what means this? Why do you look on me?</div>
                     <div class="line">I see no more in you than in the ordinary</div>
                     <div class="line">Of nature's sale-work. 'Od's my little life,</div>
                     <div class="line">I think she means to tangle my eyes too!</div>
                     <div class="line">No, faith, proud mistress, hope not after it:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not your inky brows, your black silk hair,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your bugle eyeballs, nor your cheek of cream,</div>
                     <div class="line">That can entame my spirits to your worship.</div>
                     <div class="line">You foolish shepherd, wherefore do you follow her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like foggy south puffing with wind and rain?</div>
                     <div class="line">You are a thousand times a properer man</div>
                     <div class="line">Than she a woman: 'tis such fools as you</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes the world full of ill-favour'd children:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not her glass, but you, that flatters her;</div>
                     <div class="line">And out of you she sees herself more proper</div>
                     <div class="line">Than any of her lineaments can show her.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, mistress, know yourself: down on your knees,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thank heaven, fasting, for a good man's love:</div>
                     <div class="line">For I must tell you friendly in your ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sell when you can: you are not for all markets:</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry the man mercy; love him; take his offer:</div>
                     <div class="line">Foul is most foul, being foul to be a scoffer.</div>
                     <div class="line">So take her to thee, shepherd: fare you well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet youth, I pray you, chide a year together:</div>
                     <div class="line">I had rather hear you chide than this man woo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">He's fallen in love with your foulness and she'll</div>
                     <div class="line">fall in love with my anger. If it be so, as fast as</div>
                     <div class="line">she answers thee with frowning looks, I'll sauce her</div>
                     <div class="line">with bitter words. Why look you so upon me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">For no ill will I bear you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, do not fall in love with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am falser than vows made in wine:</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, I like you not. If you will know my house,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis at the tuft of olives here hard by.</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you go, sister? Shepherd, ply her hard.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sister. Shepherdess, look on him better,</div>
                     <div class="line">And be not proud: though all the world could see,</div>
                     <div class="line">None could be so abused in sight as he.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, to our flock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt ROSALIND, CELIA and CORIN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead Shepherd, now I find thy saw of might,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who ever loved that loved not at first sight?'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Phebe,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, what say'st thou, Silvius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Phebe, pity me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, I am sorry for thee, gentle Silvius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherever sorrow is, relief would be:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you do sorrow at my grief in love,</div>
                     <div class="line">By giving love your sorrow and my grief</div>
                     <div class="line">Were both extermined.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast my love: is not that neighbourly?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that were covetousness.</div>
                     <div class="line">Silvius, the time was that I hated thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet it is not that I bear thee love;</div>
                     <div class="line">But since that thou canst talk of love so well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy company, which erst was irksome to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will endure, and I'll employ thee too:</div>
                     <div class="line">But do not look for further recompense</div>
                     <div class="line">Than thine own gladness that thou art employ'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So holy and so perfect is my love,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I in such a poverty of grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I shall think it a most plenteous crop</div>
                     <div class="line">To glean the broken ears after the man</div>
                     <div class="line">That the main harvest reaps: loose now and then</div>
                     <div class="line">A scatter'd smile, and that I'll live upon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Know'st now the youth that spoke to me erewhile?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not very well, but I have met him oft;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he hath bought the cottage and the bounds</div>
                     <div class="line">That the old carlot once was master of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Think not I love him, though I ask for him:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but a peevish boy; yet he talks well;</div>
                     <div class="line">But what care I for words? yet words do well</div>
                     <div class="line">When he that speaks them pleases those that hear.</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a pretty youth: not very pretty:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, sure, he's proud, and yet his pride becomes him:</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll make a proper man: the best thing in him</div>
                     <div class="line">Is his complexion; and faster than his tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Did make offence his eye did heal it up.</div>
                     <div class="line">He is not very tall; yet for his years he's tall:</div>
                     <div class="line">His leg is but so so; and yet 'tis well:</div>
                     <div class="line">There was a pretty redness in his lip,</div>
                     <div class="line">A little riper and more lusty red</div>
                     <div class="line">Than that mix'd in his cheek; 'twas just the difference</div>
                     <div class="line">Between the constant red and mingled damask.</div>
                     <div class="line">There be some women, Silvius, had they mark'd him</div>
                     <div class="line">In parcels as I did, would have gone near</div>
                     <div class="line">To fall in love with him; but, for my part,</div>
                     <div class="line">I love him not nor hate him not; and yet</div>
                     <div class="line">I have more cause to hate him than to love him:</div>
                     <div class="line">For what had he to do to chide at me?</div>
                     <div class="line">He said mine eyes were black and my hair black:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, now I am remember'd, scorn'd at me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I marvel why I answer'd not again:</div>
                     <div class="line">But that's all one; omittance is no quittance.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll write to him a very taunting letter,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt bear it: wilt thou, Silvius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Phebe, with all my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll write it straight;</div>
                     <div class="line">The matter's in my head and in my heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be bitter with him and passing short.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go with me, Silvius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSALIND, CELIA, and JAQUES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, pretty youth, let me be better acquainted</div>
                     <div class="line">with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">They say you are a melancholy fellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I am so; I do love it better than laughing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Those that are in extremity of either are abominable</div>
                     <div class="line">fellows and betray themselves to every modern</div>
                     <div class="line">censure worse than drunkards.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, 'tis good to be sad and say nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then, 'tis good to be a post.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">I have neither the scholar's melancholy, which is</div>
                     <div class="line">emulation, nor the musician's, which is fantastical,</div>
                     <div class="line">nor the courtier's, which is proud, nor the</div>
                     <div class="line">soldier's, which is ambitious, nor the lawyer's,</div>
                     <div class="line">which is politic, nor the lady's, which is nice, nor</div>
                     <div class="line">the lover's, which is all these: but it is a</div>
                     <div class="line">melancholy of mine own, compounded of many simples,</div>
                     <div class="line">extracted from many objects, and indeed the sundry's</div>
                     <div class="line">contemplation of my travels, in which my often</div>
                     <div class="line">rumination wraps me m a most humorous sadness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">A traveller! By my faith, you have great reason to</div>
                     <div class="line">be sad: I fear you have sold your own lands to see</div>
                     <div class="line">other men's; then, to have seen much and to have</div>
                     <div class="line">nothing, is to have rich eyes and poor hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, I have gained my experience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">And your experience makes you sad: I had rather have</div>
                     <div class="line">a fool to make me merry than experience to make me</div>
                     <div class="line">sad; and to travel for it too!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ORLANDO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good day and happiness, dear Rosalind!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, then, God be wi' you, an you talk in blank verse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, Monsieur Traveller: look you lisp and</div>
                     <div class="line">wear strange suits, disable all the benefits of your</div>
                     <div class="line">own country, be out of love with your nativity and</div>
                     <div class="line">almost chide God for making you that countenance you</div>
                     <div class="line">are, or I will scarce think you have swam in a</div>
                     <div class="line">gondola. Why, how now, Orlando! where have you been</div>
                     <div class="line">all this while? You a lover! An you serve me such</div>
                     <div class="line">another trick, never come in my sight more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">My fair Rosalind, I come within an hour of my promise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Break an hour's promise in love! He that will</div>
                     <div class="line">divide a minute into a thousand parts and break but</div>
                     <div class="line">a part of the thousandth part of a minute in the</div>
                     <div class="line">affairs of love, it may be said of him that Cupid</div>
                     <div class="line">hath clapped him o' the shoulder, but I'll warrant</div>
                     <div class="line">him heart-whole.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, dear Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, an you be so tardy, come no more in my sight: I</div>
                     <div class="line">had as lief be wooed of a snail.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Of a snail?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, of a snail; for though he comes slowly, he</div>
                     <div class="line">carries his house on his head; a better jointure,</div>
                     <div class="line">I think, than you make a woman: besides he brings</div>
                     <div class="line">his destiny with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, horns, which such as you are fain to be</div>
                     <div class="line">beholding to your wives for: but he comes armed in</div>
                     <div class="line">his fortune and prevents the slander of his wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue is no horn-maker; and my Rosalind is virtuous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am your Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">It pleases him to call you so; but he hath a</div>
                     <div class="line">Rosalind of a better leer than you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, woo me, woo me, for now I am in a holiday</div>
                     <div class="line">humour and like enough to consent. What would you</div>
                     <div class="line">say to me now, an I were your very very Rosalind?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I would kiss before I spoke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, you were better speak first, and when you were</div>
                     <div class="line">gravelled for lack of matter, you might take</div>
                     <div class="line">occasion to kiss. Very good orators, when they are</div>
                     <div class="line">out, they will spit; and for lovers lacking--God</div>
                     <div class="line">warn us!--matter, the cleanliest shift is to kiss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">How if the kiss be denied?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Then she puts you to entreaty, and there begins new matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who could be out, being before his beloved mistress?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, that should you, if I were your mistress, or</div>
                     <div class="line">I should think my honesty ranker than my wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">What, of my suit?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Not out of your apparel, and yet out of your suit.</div>
                     <div class="line">Am not I your Rosalind?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I take some joy to say you are, because I would be</div>
                     <div class="line">talking of her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Well in her person I say I will not have you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Then in mine own person I die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">No, faith, die by attorney. The poor world is</div>
                     <div class="line">almost six thousand years old, and in all this time</div>
                     <div class="line">there was not any man died in his own person,</div>
                     <div class="line">videlicit, in a love-cause. Troilus had his brains</div>
                     <div class="line">dashed out with a Grecian club; yet he did what he</div>
                     <div class="line">could to die before, and he is one of the patterns</div>
                     <div class="line">of love. Leander, he would have lived many a fair</div>
                     <div class="line">year, though Hero had turned nun, if it had not been</div>
                     <div class="line">for a hot midsummer night; for, good youth, he went</div>
                     <div class="line">but forth to wash him in the Hellespont and being</div>
                     <div class="line">taken with the cramp was drowned and the foolish</div>
                     <div class="line">coroners of that age found it was 'Hero of Sestos.'</div>
                     <div class="line">But these are all lies: men have died from time to</div>
                     <div class="line">time and worms have eaten them, but not for love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not have my right Rosalind of this mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">for, I protest, her frown might kill me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">By this hand, it will not kill a fly. But come, now</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be your Rosalind in a more coming-on</div>
                     <div class="line">disposition, and ask me what you will. I will grant</div>
                     <div class="line">it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Then love me, Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, faith, will I, Fridays and Saturdays and all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">And wilt thou have me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and twenty such.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">What sayest thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you not good?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then, can one desire too much of a good thing?</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sister, you shall be the priest and marry us.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me your hand, Orlando. What do you say, sister?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray thee, marry us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot say the words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">You must begin, 'Will you, Orlando--'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to. Will you, Orlando, have to wife this Rosalind?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but when?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why now; as fast as she can marry us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you must say 'I take thee, Rosalind, for wife.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I take thee, Rosalind, for wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I might ask you for your commission; but I do take</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, Orlando, for my husband: there's a girl goes</div>
                     <div class="line">before the priest; and certainly a woman's thought</div>
                     <div class="line">runs before her actions.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">So do all thoughts; they are winged.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Now tell me how long you would have her after you</div>
                     <div class="line">have possessed her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">For ever and a day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Say 'a day,' without the 'ever.' No, no, Orlando;</div>
                     <div class="line">men are April when they woo, December when they wed:</div>
                     <div class="line">maids are May when they are maids, but the sky</div>
                     <div class="line">changes when they are wives. I will be more jealous</div>
                     <div class="line">of thee than a Barbary cock-pigeon over his hen,</div>
                     <div class="line">more clamorous than a parrot against rain, more</div>
                     <div class="line">new-fangled than an ape, more giddy in my desires</div>
                     <div class="line">than a monkey: I will weep for nothing, like Diana</div>
                     <div class="line">in the fountain, and I will do that when you are</div>
                     <div class="line">disposed to be merry; I will laugh like a hyen, and</div>
                     <div class="line">that when thou art inclined to sleep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">But will my Rosalind do so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">By my life, she will do as I do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, but she is wise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else she could not have the wit to do this: the</div>
                     <div class="line">wiser, the waywarder: make the doors upon a woman's</div>
                     <div class="line">wit and it will out at the casement; shut that and</div>
                     <div class="line">'twill out at the key-hole; stop that, 'twill fly</div>
                     <div class="line">with the smoke out at the chimney.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">A man that had a wife with such a wit, he might say</div>
                     <div class="line">'Wit, whither wilt?'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, you might keep that cheque for it till you met</div>
                     <div class="line">your wife's wit going to your neighbour's bed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">And what wit could wit have to excuse that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, to say she came to seek you there. You shall</div>
                     <div class="line">never take her without her answer, unless you take</div>
                     <div class="line">her without her tongue. O, that woman that cannot</div>
                     <div class="line">make her fault her husband's occasion, let her</div>
                     <div class="line">never nurse her child herself, for she will breed</div>
                     <div class="line">it like a fool!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">For these two hours, Rosalind, I will leave thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas! dear love, I cannot lack thee two hours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I must attend the duke at dinner: by two o'clock I</div>
                     <div class="line">will be with thee again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, go your ways, go your ways; I knew what you</div>
                     <div class="line">would prove: my friends told me as much, and I</div>
                     <div class="line">thought no less: that flattering tongue of yours</div>
                     <div class="line">won me: 'tis but one cast away, and so, come,</div>
                     <div class="line">death! Two o'clock is your hour?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sweet Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, and in good earnest, and so God mend</div>
                     <div class="line">me, and by all pretty oaths that are not dangerous,</div>
                     <div class="line">if you break one jot of your promise or come one</div>
                     <div class="line">minute behind your hour, I will think you the most</div>
                     <div class="line">pathetical break-promise and the most hollow lover</div>
                     <div class="line">and the most unworthy of her you call Rosalind that</div>
                     <div class="line">may be chosen out of the gross band of the</div>
                     <div class="line">unfaithful: therefore beware my censure and keep</div>
                     <div class="line">your promise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">With no less religion than if thou wert indeed my</div>
                     <div class="line">Rosalind: so adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, Time is the old justice that examines all such</div>
                     <div class="line">offenders, and let Time try: adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit ORLANDO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You have simply misused our sex in your love-prate:</div>
                     <div class="line">we must have your doublet and hose plucked over your</div>
                     <div class="line">head, and show the world what the bird hath done to</div>
                     <div class="line">her own nest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">O coz, coz, coz, my pretty little coz, that thou</div>
                     <div class="line">didst know how many fathom deep I am in love! But</div>
                     <div class="line">it cannot be sounded: my affection hath an unknown</div>
                     <div class="line">bottom, like the bay of Portugal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Or rather, bottomless, that as fast as you pour</div>
                     <div class="line">affection in, it runs out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">No, that same wicked bastard of Venus that was begot</div>
                     <div class="line">of thought, conceived of spleen and born of madness,</div>
                     <div class="line">that blind rascally boy that abuses every one's eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">because his own are out, let him be judge how deep I</div>
                     <div class="line">am in love. I'll tell thee, Aliena, I cannot be out</div>
                     <div class="line">of the sight of Orlando: I'll go find a shadow and</div>
                     <div class="line">sigh till he come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll sleep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JAQUES, Lords, and Foresters</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is he that killed the deer?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">A Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, it was I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's present him to the duke, like a Roman</div>
                     <div class="line">conqueror; and it would do well to set the deer's</div>
                     <div class="line">horns upon his head, for a branch of victory. Have</div>
                     <div class="line">you no song, forester, for this purpose?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Forester</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Sing it: 'tis no matter how it be in tune, so it</div>
                     <div class="line">make noise enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Forester</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall he have that kill'd the deer?</div>
                     <div class="line">His leather skin and horns to wear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then sing him home;</div>
                     <p>The rest shall bear this burden</p>
                     <div class="line">Take thou no scorn to wear the horn;</div>
                     <div class="line">It was a crest ere thou wast born:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy father's father wore it,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thy father bore it:</div>
                     <div class="line">The horn, the horn, the lusty horn</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not a thing to laugh to scorn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSALIND and CELIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">How say you now? Is it not past two o'clock? and</div>
                     <div class="line">here much Orlando!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I warrant you, with pure love and troubled brain, he</div>
                     <div class="line">hath ta'en his bow and arrows and is gone forth to</div>
                     <div class="line">sleep. Look, who comes here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SILVIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My errand is to you, fair youth;</div>
                     <div class="line">My gentle Phebe bid me give you this:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not the contents; but, as I guess</div>
                     <div class="line">By the stern brow and waspish action</div>
                     <div class="line">Which she did use as she was writing of it,</div>
                     <div class="line">It bears an angry tenor: pardon me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am but as a guiltless messenger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience herself would startle at this letter</div>
                     <div class="line">And play the swaggerer; bear this, bear all:</div>
                     <div class="line">She says I am not fair, that I lack manners;</div>
                     <div class="line">She calls me proud, and that she could not love me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were man as rare as phoenix. 'Od's my will!</div>
                     <div class="line">Her love is not the hare that I do hunt:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why writes she so to me? Well, shepherd, well,</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a letter of your own device.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I protest, I know not the contents:</div>
                     <div class="line">Phebe did write it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, you are a fool</div>
                     <div class="line">And turn'd into the extremity of love.</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw her hand: she has a leathern hand.</div>
                     <div class="line">A freestone-colour'd hand; I verily did think</div>
                     <div class="line">That her old gloves were on, but 'twas her hands:</div>
                     <div class="line">She has a huswife's hand; but that's no matter:</div>
                     <div class="line">I say she never did invent this letter;</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a man's invention and his hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sure, it is hers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, 'tis a boisterous and a cruel style.</div>
                     <div class="line">A style for-challengers; why, she defies me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like Turk to Christian: women's gentle brain</div>
                     <div class="line">Could not drop forth such giant-rude invention</div>
                     <div class="line">Such Ethiope words, blacker in their effect</div>
                     <div class="line">Than in their countenance. Will you hear the letter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So please you, for I never heard it yet;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet heard too much of Phebe's cruelty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">She Phebes me: mark how the tyrant writes.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">Art thou god to shepherd turn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">That a maiden's heart hath burn'd?</div>
                     <div class="line">Can a woman rail thus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Call you this railing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">Why, thy godhead laid apart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Warr'st thou with a woman's heart?</div>
                     <div class="line">Did you ever hear such railing?</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles the eye of man did woo me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That could do no vengeance to me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Meaning me a beast.</div>
                     <div class="line">If the scorn of your bright eyne</div>
                     <div class="line">Have power to raise such love in mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, in me what strange effect</div>
                     <div class="line">Would they work in mild aspect!</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles you chid me, I did love;</div>
                     <div class="line">How then might your prayers move!</div>
                     <div class="line">He that brings this love to thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Little knows this love in me:</div>
                     <div class="line">And by him seal up thy mind;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether that thy youth and kind</div>
                     <div class="line">Will the faithful offer take</div>
                     <div class="line">Of me and all that I can make;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else by him my love deny,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then I'll study how to die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Call you this chiding?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor shepherd!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you pity him? no, he deserves no pity. Wilt</div>
                     <div class="line">thou love such a woman? What, to make thee an</div>
                     <div class="line">instrument and play false strains upon thee! not to</div>
                     <div class="line">be endured! Well, go your way to her, for I see</div>
                     <div class="line">love hath made thee a tame snake, and say this to</div>
                     <div class="line">her: that if she love me, I charge her to love</div>
                     <div class="line">thee; if she will not, I will never have her unless</div>
                     <div class="line">thou entreat for her. If you be a true lover,</div>
                     <div class="line">hence, and not a word; for here comes more company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit SILVIUS</p>
               <p>Enter OLIVER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
