                     <div class="line">Good morrow, fair ones: pray you, if you know,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where in the purlieus of this forest stands</div>
                     <div class="line">A sheep-cote fenced about with olive trees?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">West of this place, down in the neighbour bottom:</div>
                     <div class="line">The rank of osiers by the murmuring stream</div>
                     <div class="line">Left on your right hand brings you to the place.</div>
                     <div class="line">But at this hour the house doth keep itself;</div>
                     <div class="line">There's none within.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">If that an eye may profit by a tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then should I know you by description;</div>
                     <div class="line">Such garments and such years: 'The boy is fair,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of female favour, and bestows himself</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a ripe sister: the woman low</div>
                     <div class="line">And browner than her brother.' Are not you</div>
                     <div class="line">The owner of the house I did inquire for?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">It is no boast, being ask'd, to say we are.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">Orlando doth commend him to you both,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to that youth he calls his Rosalind</div>
                     <div class="line">He sends this bloody napkin. Are you he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I am: what must we understand by this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">Some of my shame; if you will know of me</div>
                     <div class="line">What man I am, and how, and why, and where</div>
                     <div class="line">This handkercher was stain'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, tell it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">When last the young Orlando parted from you</div>
                     <div class="line">He left a promise to return again</div>
                     <div class="line">Within an hour, and pacing through the forest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Chewing the food of sweet and bitter fancy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, what befell! he threw his eye aside,</div>
                     <div class="line">And mark what object did present itself:</div>
                     <div class="line">Under an oak, whose boughs were moss'd with age</div>
                     <div class="line">And high top bald with dry antiquity,</div>
                     <div class="line">A wretched ragged man, o'ergrown with hair,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay sleeping on his back: about his neck</div>
                     <div class="line">A green and gilded snake had wreathed itself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who with her head nimble in threats approach'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The opening of his mouth; but suddenly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeing Orlando, it unlink'd itself,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with indented glides did slip away</div>
                     <div class="line">Into a bush: under which bush's shade</div>
                     <div class="line">A lioness, with udders all drawn dry,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay couching, head on ground, with catlike watch,</div>
                     <div class="line">When that the sleeping man should stir; for 'tis</div>
                     <div class="line">The royal disposition of that beast</div>
                     <div class="line">To prey on nothing that doth seem as dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">This seen, Orlando did approach the man</div>
                     <div class="line">And found it was his brother, his elder brother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I have heard him speak of that same brother;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he did render him the most unnatural</div>
                     <div class="line">That lived amongst men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">And well he might so do,</div>
                     <div class="line">For well I know he was unnatural.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">But, to Orlando: did he leave him there,</div>
                     <div class="line">Food to the suck'd and hungry lioness?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">Twice did he turn his back and purposed so;</div>
                     <div class="line">But kindness, nobler ever than revenge,</div>
                     <div class="line">And nature, stronger than his just occasion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made him give battle to the lioness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who quickly fell before him: in which hurtling</div>
                     <div class="line">From miserable slumber I awaked.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you his brother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Wast you he rescued?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Was't you that did so oft contrive to kill him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas I; but 'tis not I I do not shame</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell you what I was, since my conversion</div>
                     <div class="line">So sweetly tastes, being the thing I am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">But, for the bloody napkin?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">By and by.</div>
                     <div class="line">When from the first to last betwixt us two</div>
                     <div class="line">Tears our recountments had most kindly bathed,</div>
                     <div class="line">As how I came into that desert place:--</div>
                     <div class="line">In brief, he led me to the gentle duke,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who gave me fresh array and entertainment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Committing me unto my brother's love;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who led me instantly unto his cave,</div>
                     <div class="line">There stripp'd himself, and here upon his arm</div>
                     <div class="line">The lioness had torn some flesh away,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which all this while had bled; and now he fainted</div>
                     <div class="line">And cried, in fainting, upon Rosalind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Brief, I recover'd him, bound up his wound;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, after some small space, being strong at heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">He sent me hither, stranger as I am,</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell this story, that you might excuse</div>
                     <div class="line">His broken promise, and to give this napkin</div>
                     <div class="line">Dyed in his blood unto the shepherd youth</div>
                     <div class="line">That he in sport doth call his Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>ROSALIND swoons</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, Ganymede! sweet Ganymede!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">Many will swoon when they do look on blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">There is more in it. Cousin Ganymede!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, he recovers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I were at home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll lead you thither.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, will you take him by the arm?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">Be of good cheer, youth: you a man! you lack a</div>
                     <div class="line">man's heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I do so, I confess it. Ah, sirrah, a body would</div>
                     <div class="line">think this was well counterfeited! I pray you, tell</div>
                     <div class="line">your brother how well I counterfeited. Heigh-ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">This was not counterfeit: there is too great</div>
                     <div class="line">testimony in your complexion that it was a passion</div>
                     <div class="line">of earnest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Counterfeit, I assure you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">Well then, take a good heart and counterfeit to be a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">So I do: but, i' faith, I should have been a woman by right.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, you look paler and paler: pray you, draw</div>
                     <div class="line">homewards. Good sir, go with us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">That will I, for I must bear answer back</div>
                     <div class="line">How you excuse my brother, Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall devise something: but, I pray you, commend</div>
                     <div class="line">my counterfeiting to him. Will you go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  The forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. EPILOGUE</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall find a time, Audrey; patience, gentle Audrey.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, the priest was good enough, for all the old</div>
                     <div class="line">gentleman's saying.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">A most wicked Sir Oliver, Audrey, a most vile</div>
                     <div class="line">Martext. But, Audrey, there is a youth here in the</div>
                     <div class="line">forest lays claim to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, I know who 'tis; he hath no interest in me in</div>
                     <div class="line">the world: here comes the man you mean.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">It is meat and drink to me to see a clown: by my</div>
                     <div class="line">troth, we that have good wits have much to answer</div>
                     <div class="line">for; we shall be flouting; we cannot hold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter WILLIAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Good even, Audrey.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">God ye good even, William.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">And good even to you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good even, gentle friend. Cover thy head, cover thy</div>
                     <div class="line">head; nay, prithee, be covered. How old are you, friend?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Five and twenty, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">A ripe age. Is thy name William?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">William, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">A fair name. Wast born i' the forest here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, I thank God.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">'Thank God;' a good answer. Art rich?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, sir, so so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">'So so' is good, very good, very excellent good; and</div>
                     <div class="line">yet it is not; it is but so so. Art thou wise?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, I have a pretty wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, thou sayest well. I do now remember a saying,</div>
                     <div class="line">'The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man</div>
                     <div class="line">knows himself to be a fool.' The heathen</div>
                     <div class="line">philosopher, when he had a desire to eat a grape,</div>
                     <div class="line">would open his lips when he put it into his mouth;</div>
                     <div class="line">meaning thereby that grapes were made to eat and</div>
                     <div class="line">lips to open. You do love this maid?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I do, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me your hand. Art thou learned?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then learn this of me: to have, is to have; for it</div>
                     <div class="line">is a figure in rhetoric that drink, being poured out</div>
                     <div class="line">of a cup into a glass, by filling the one doth empty</div>
                     <div class="line">the other; for all your writers do consent that ipse</div>
                     <div class="line">is he: now, you are not ipse, for I am he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">He, sir, that must marry this woman. Therefore, you</div>
                     <div class="line">clown, abandon,--which is in the vulgar leave,--the</div>
                     <div class="line">society,--which in the boorish is company,--of this</div>
                     <div class="line">female,--which in the common is woman; which</div>
                     <div class="line">together is, abandon the society of this female, or,</div>
                     <div class="line">clown, thou perishest; or, to thy better</div>
                     <div class="line">understanding, diest; or, to wit I kill thee, make</div>
                     <div class="line">thee away, translate thy life into death, thy</div>
                     <div class="line">liberty into bondage: I will deal in poison with</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, or in bastinado, or in steel; I will bandy</div>
                     <div class="line">with thee in faction; I will o'errun thee with</div>
                     <div class="line">policy; I will kill thee a hundred and fifty ways:</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore tremble and depart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, good William.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WILLIAM</div>
                     <div class="line">God rest you merry, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter CORIN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Our master and mistress seeks you; come, away, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Trip, Audrey! trip, Audrey! I attend, I attend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ORLANDO and OLIVER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible that on so little acquaintance you</div>
                     <div class="line">should like her? that but seeing you should love</div>
                     <div class="line">her? and loving woo? and, wooing, she should</div>
                     <div class="line">grant? and will you persever to enjoy her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither call the giddiness of it in question, the</div>
                     <div class="line">poverty of her, the small acquaintance, my sudden</div>
                     <div class="line">wooing, nor her sudden consenting; but say with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I love Aliena; say with her that she loves me;</div>
                     <div class="line">consent with both that we may enjoy each other: it</div>
                     <div class="line">shall be to your good; for my father's house and all</div>
                     <div class="line">the revenue that was old Sir Rowland's will I</div>
                     <div class="line">estate upon you, and here live and die a shepherd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">You have my consent. Let your wedding be to-morrow:</div>
                     <div class="line">thither will I invite the duke and all's contented</div>
                     <div class="line">followers. Go you and prepare Aliena; for look</div>
                     <div class="line">you, here comes my Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSALIND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">God save you, brother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OLIVER</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, fair sister.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my dear Orlando, how it grieves me to see thee</div>
                     <div class="line">wear thy heart in a scarf!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">It is my arm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought thy heart had been wounded with the claws</div>
                     <div class="line">of a lion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Wounded it is, but with the eyes of a lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Did your brother tell you how I counterfeited to</div>
                     <div class="line">swoon when he showed me your handkerchief?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and greater wonders than that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I know where you are: nay, 'tis true: there was</div>
                     <div class="line">never any thing so sudden but the fight of two rams</div>
                     <div class="line">and Caesar's thrasonical brag of 'I came, saw, and</div>
                     <div class="line">overcame:' for your brother and my sister no sooner</div>
                     <div class="line">met but they looked, no sooner looked but they</div>
                     <div class="line">loved, no sooner loved but they sighed, no sooner</div>
                     <div class="line">sighed but they asked one another the reason, no</div>
                     <div class="line">sooner knew the reason but they sought the remedy;</div>
                     <div class="line">and in these degrees have they made a pair of stairs</div>
                     <div class="line">to marriage which they will climb incontinent, or</div>
                     <div class="line">else be incontinent before marriage: they are in</div>
                     <div class="line">the very wrath of love and they will together; clubs</div>
                     <div class="line">cannot part them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">They shall be married to-morrow, and I will bid the</div>
                     <div class="line">duke to the nuptial. But, O, how bitter a thing it</div>
                     <div class="line">is to look into happiness through another man's</div>
                     <div class="line">eyes! By so much the more shall I to-morrow be at</div>
                     <div class="line">the height of heart-heaviness, by how much I shall</div>
                     <div class="line">think my brother happy in having what he wishes for.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then, to-morrow I cannot serve your turn for Rosalind?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I can live no longer by thinking.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I will weary you then no longer with idle talking.</div>
                     <div class="line">Know of me then, for now I speak to some purpose,</div>
                     <div class="line">that I know you are a gentleman of good conceit: I</div>
                     <div class="line">speak not this that you should bear a good opinion</div>
                     <div class="line">of my knowledge, insomuch I say I know you are;</div>
                     <div class="line">neither do I labour for a greater esteem than may in</div>
                     <div class="line">some little measure draw a belief from you, to do</div>
                     <div class="line">yourself good and not to grace me. Believe then, if</div>
                     <div class="line">you please, that I can do strange things: I have,</div>
                     <div class="line">since I was three year old, conversed with a</div>
                     <div class="line">magician, most profound in his art and yet not</div>
                     <div class="line">damnable. If you do love Rosalind so near the heart</div>
                     <div class="line">as your gesture cries it out, when your brother</div>
                     <div class="line">marries Aliena, shall you marry her: I know into</div>
                     <div class="line">what straits of fortune she is driven; and it is</div>
                     <div class="line">not impossible to me, if it appear not inconvenient</div>
                     <div class="line">to you, to set her before your eyes tomorrow human</div>
                     <div class="line">as she is and without any danger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Speakest thou in sober meanings?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">By my life, I do; which I tender dearly, though I</div>
                     <div class="line">say I am a magician. Therefore, put you in your</div>
                     <div class="line">best array: bid your friends; for if you will be</div>
                     <div class="line">married to-morrow, you shall, and to Rosalind, if you will.</div>
                     <p>Enter SILVIUS and PHEBE</p>
                     <div class="line">Look, here comes a lover of mine and a lover of hers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Youth, you have done me much ungentleness,</div>
                     <div class="line">To show the letter that I writ to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I care not if I have: it is my study</div>
                     <div class="line">To seem despiteful and ungentle to you:</div>
                     <div class="line">You are there followed by a faithful shepherd;</div>
                     <div class="line">Look upon him, love him; he worships you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good shepherd, tell this youth what 'tis to love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is to be all made of sighs and tears;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I for Phebe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for Ganymede.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for no woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is to be all made of faith and service;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I for Phebe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for Ganymede.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for no woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is to be all made of fantasy,</div>
                     <div class="line">All made of passion and all made of wishes,</div>
                     <div class="line">All adoration, duty, and observance,</div>
                     <div class="line">All humbleness, all patience and impatience,</div>
                     <div class="line">All purity, all trial, all observance;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I for Phebe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I for Ganymede.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I for Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I for no woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">If this be so, why blame you me to love you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If this be so, why blame you me to love you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">If this be so, why blame you me to love you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Who do you speak to, 'Why blame you me to love you?'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">To her that is not here, nor doth not hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, no more of this; 'tis like the howling</div>
                     <div class="line">of Irish wolves against the moon.</div>
                     <p>To SILVIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">I will help you, if I can:</div>
                     <p>To PHEBE</p>
                     <div class="line">I would love you, if I could. To-morrow meet me all together.</div>
                     <p>To PHEBE</p>
                     <div class="line">I will marry you, if ever I marry woman, and I'll be</div>
                     <div class="line">married to-morrow:</div>
                     <p>To ORLANDO</p>
                     <div class="line">I will satisfy you, if ever I satisfied man, and you</div>
                     <div class="line">shall be married to-morrow:</div>
                     <p>To SILVIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">I will content you, if what pleases you contents</div>
                     <div class="line">you, and you shall be married to-morrow.</div>
                     <p>To ORLANDO</p>
                     <div class="line">As you love Rosalind, meet:</div>
                     <p>To SILVIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">as you love Phebe, meet: and as I love no woman,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll meet. So fare you well: I have left you commands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll not fail, if I live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow is the joyful day, Audrey; to-morrow will</div>
                     <div class="line">we be married.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                     <div class="line">I do desire it with all my heart; and I hope it is</div>
                     <div class="line">no dishonest desire to desire to be a woman of the</div>
                     <div class="line">world. Here comes two of the banished duke's pages.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two Pages</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Page</div>
                     <div class="line">Well met, honest gentleman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, well met. Come, sit, sit, and a song.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Page</div>
                     <div class="line">We are for you: sit i' the middle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Page</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we clap into't roundly, without hawking or</div>
                     <div class="line">spitting or saying we are hoarse, which are the only</div>
                     <div class="line">prologues to a bad voice?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Page</div>
                     <div class="line">I'faith, i'faith; and both in a tune, like two</div>
                     <div class="line">gipsies on a horse.</div>
                     <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
                     <div class="line">It was a lover and his lass,</div>
                     <div class="line">With a hey, and a ho, and a hey nonino,</div>
                     <div class="line">That o'er the green corn-field did pass</div>
                     <div class="line">In the spring time, the only pretty ring time,</div>
                     <div class="line">When birds do sing, hey ding a ding, ding:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet lovers love the spring.</div>
                     <div class="line">Between the acres of the rye,</div>
                     <div class="line">With a hey, and a ho, and a hey nonino</div>
                     <div class="line">These pretty country folks would lie,</div>
                     <div class="line">In spring time, &c.</div>
                     <div class="line">This carol they began that hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">With a hey, and a ho, and a hey nonino,</div>
                     <div class="line">How that a life was but a flower</div>
                     <div class="line">In spring time, &c.</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore take the present time,</div>
                     <div class="line">With a hey, and a ho, and a hey nonino;</div>
                     <div class="line">For love is crowned with the prime</div>
                     <div class="line">In spring time, &c.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, young gentlemen, though there was no great</div>
                     <div class="line">matter in the ditty, yet the note was very</div>
                     <div class="line">untuneable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Page</div>
                     <div class="line">You are deceived, sir: we kept time, we lost not our time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, yes; I count it but time lost to hear</div>
                     <div class="line">such a foolish song. God be wi' you; and God mend</div>
                     <div class="line">your voices! Come, Audrey.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE SENIOR, AMIENS, JAQUES, ORLANDO, OLIVER,
and CELIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou believe, Orlando, that the boy</div>
                     <div class="line">Can do all this that he hath promised?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">I sometimes do believe, and sometimes do not;</div>
                     <div class="line">As those that fear they hope, and know they fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSALIND, SILVIUS, and PHEBE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience once more, whiles our compact is urged:</div>
                     <div class="line">You say, if I bring in your Rosalind,</div>
                     <div class="line">You will bestow her on Orlando here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">That would I, had I kingdoms to give with her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">And you say, you will have her, when I bring her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">That would I, were I of all kingdoms king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">You say, you'll marry me, if I be willing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">That will I, should I die the hour after.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">But if you do refuse to marry me,</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll give yourself to this most faithful shepherd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">So is the bargain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">You say, that you'll have Phebe, if she will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Though to have her and death were both one thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I have promised to make all this matter even.</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep you your word, O duke, to give your daughter;</div>
                     <div class="line">You yours, Orlando, to receive his daughter:</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep your word, Phebe, that you'll marry me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else refusing me, to wed this shepherd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep your word, Silvius, that you'll marry her.</div>
                     <div class="line">If she refuse me: and from hence I go,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make these doubts all even.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt ROSALIND and CELIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I do remember in this shepherd boy</div>
                     <div class="line">Some lively touches of my daughter's favour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, the first time that I ever saw him</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought he was a brother to your daughter:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, my good lord, this boy is forest-born,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hath been tutor'd in the rudiments</div>
                     <div class="line">Of many desperate studies by his uncle,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom he reports to be a great magician,</div>
                     <div class="line">Obscured in the circle of this forest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">There is, sure, another flood toward, and these</div>
                     <div class="line">couples are coming to the ark. Here comes a pair of</div>
                     <div class="line">very strange beasts, which in all tongues are called fools.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Salutation and greeting to you all!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my lord, bid him welcome: this is the</div>
                     <div class="line">motley-minded gentleman that I have so often met in</div>
                     <div class="line">the forest: he hath been a courtier, he swears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">If any man doubt that, let him put me to my</div>
                     <div class="line">purgation. I have trod a measure; I have flattered</div>
                     <div class="line">a lady; I have been politic with my friend, smooth</div>
                     <div class="line">with mine enemy; I have undone three tailors; I have</div>
                     <div class="line">had four quarrels, and like to have fought one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">And how was that ta'en up?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, we met, and found the quarrel was upon the</div>
                     <div class="line">seventh cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">How seventh cause? Good my lord, like this fellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I like him very well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">God 'ild you, sir; I desire you of the like. I</div>
                     <div class="line">press in here, sir, amongst the rest of the country</div>
                     <div class="line">copulatives, to swear and to forswear: according as</div>
                     <div class="line">marriage binds and blood breaks: a poor virgin,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir, an ill-favoured thing, sir, but mine own; a poor</div>
                     <div class="line">humour of mine, sir, to take that that no man else</div>
                     <div class="line">will: rich honesty dwells like a miser, sir, in a</div>
                     <div class="line">poor house; as your pearl in your foul oyster.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">By my faith, he is very swift and sententious.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">According to the fool's bolt, sir, and such dulcet diseases.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">But, for the seventh cause; how did you find the</div>
                     <div class="line">quarrel on the seventh cause?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon a lie seven times removed:--bear your body more</div>
                     <div class="line">seeming, Audrey:--as thus, sir. I did dislike the</div>
                     <div class="line">cut of a certain courtier's beard: he sent me word,</div>
                     <div class="line">if I said his beard was not cut well, he was in the</div>
                     <div class="line">mind it was: this is called the Retort Courteous.</div>
                     <div class="line">If I sent him word again 'it was not well cut,' he</div>
                     <div class="line">would send me word, he cut it to please himself:</div>
                     <div class="line">this is called the Quip Modest. If again 'it was</div>
                     <div class="line">not well cut,' he disabled my judgment: this is</div>
                     <div class="line">called the Reply Churlish. If again 'it was not</div>
                     <div class="line">well cut,' he would answer, I spake not true: this</div>
                     <div class="line">is called the Reproof Valiant. If again 'it was not</div>
                     <div class="line">well cut,' he would say I lied: this is called the</div>
                     <div class="line">Counter-cheque Quarrelsome: and so to the Lie</div>
                     <div class="line">Circumstantial and the Lie Direct.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">And how oft did you say his beard was not well cut?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">I durst go no further than the Lie Circumstantial,</div>
                     <div class="line">nor he durst not give me the Lie Direct; and so we</div>
                     <div class="line">measured swords and parted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you nominate in order now the degrees of the lie?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                     <div class="line">O sir, we quarrel in print, by the book; as you have</div>
                     <div class="line">books for good manners: I will name you the degrees.</div>
                     <div class="line">The first, the Retort Courteous; the second, the</div>
                     <div class="line">Quip Modest; the third, the Reply Churlish; the</div>
                     <div class="line">fourth, the Reproof Valiant; the fifth, the</div>
                     <div class="line">Countercheque Quarrelsome; the sixth, the Lie with</div>
                     <div class="line">Circumstance; the seventh, the Lie Direct. All</div>
                     <div class="line">these you may avoid but the Lie Direct; and you may</div>
                     <div class="line">avoid that too, with an If. I knew when seven</div>
                     <div class="line">justices could not take up a quarrel, but when the</div>
                     <div class="line">parties were met themselves, one of them thought but</div>
                     <div class="line">of an If, as, 'If you said so, then I said so;' and</div>
                     <div class="line">they shook hands and swore brothers. Your If is the</div>
                     <div class="line">only peacemaker; much virtue in If.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not this a rare fellow, my lord? he's as good at</div>
                     <div class="line">any thing and yet a fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">He uses his folly like a stalking-horse and under</div>
                     <div class="line">the presentation of that he shoots his wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HYMEN, ROSALIND, and CELIA</p>
               <p>Still Music</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HYMEN</div>
                     <div class="line">Then is there mirth in heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">When earthly things made even</div>
                     <div class="line">Atone together.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good duke, receive thy daughter</div>
                     <div class="line">Hymen from heaven brought her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, brought her hither,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou mightst join her hand with his</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose heart within his bosom is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To DUKE SENIOR</span>  To you I give myself, for I am yours.</div>
                     <p>To ORLANDO</p>
                     <div class="line">To you I give myself, for I am yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">If there be truth in sight, you are my daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                     <div class="line">If there be truth in sight, you are my Rosalind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">If sight and shape be true,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then, my love adieu!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have no father, if you be not he:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have no husband, if you be not he:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor ne'er wed woman, if you be not she.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HYMEN</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, ho! I bar confusion:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis I must make conclusion</div>
                     <div class="line">Of these most strange events:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's eight that must take hands</div>
                     <div class="line">To join in Hymen's bands,</div>
                     <div class="line">If truth holds true contents.</div>
                     <div class="line">You and you no cross shall part:</div>
                     <div class="line">You and you are heart in heart</div>
                     <div class="line">You to his love must accord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or have a woman to your lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">You and you are sure together,</div>
                     <div class="line">As the winter to foul weather.</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles a wedlock-hymn we sing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Feed yourselves with questioning;</div>
                     <div class="line">That reason wonder may diminish,</div>
                     <div class="line">How thus we met, and these things finish.</div>
                     <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
                     <div class="line">Wedding is great Juno's crown:</div>
                     <div class="line">O blessed bond of board and bed!</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis Hymen peoples every town;</div>
                     <div class="line">High wedlock then be honoured:</div>
                     <div class="line">Honour, high honour and renown,</div>
                     <div class="line">To Hymen, god of every town!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">O my dear niece, welcome thou art to me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Even daughter, welcome, in no less degree.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not eat my word, now thou art mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy faith my fancy to thee doth combine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JAQUES DE BOYS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES DE BOYS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me have audience for a word or two:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am the second son of old Sir Rowland,</div>
                     <div class="line">That bring these tidings to this fair assembly.</div>
                     <div class="line">Duke Frederick, hearing how that every day</div>
                     <div class="line">Men of great worth resorted to this forest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Address'd a mighty power; which were on foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">In his own conduct, purposely to take</div>
                     <div class="line">His brother here and put him to the sword:</div>
                     <div class="line">And to the skirts of this wild wood he came;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where meeting with an old religious man,</div>
                     <div class="line">After some question with him, was converted</div>
                     <div class="line">Both from his enterprise and from the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">His crown bequeathing to his banish'd brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all their lands restored to them again</div>
                     <div class="line">That were with him exiled. This to be true,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do engage my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, young man;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou offer'st fairly to thy brothers' wedding:</div>
                     <div class="line">To one his lands withheld, and to the other</div>
                     <div class="line">A land itself at large, a potent dukedom.</div>
                     <div class="line">First, in this forest, let us do those ends</div>
                     <div class="line">That here were well begun and well begot:</div>
                     <div class="line">And after, every of this happy number</div>
                     <div class="line">That have endured shrewd days and nights with us</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall share the good of our returned fortune,</div>
                     <div class="line">According to the measure of their states.</div>
                     <div class="line">Meantime, forget this new-fall'n dignity</div>
                     <div class="line">And fall into our rustic revelry.</div>
                     <div class="line">Play, music! And you, brides and bridegrooms all,</div>
                     <div class="line">With measure heap'd in joy, to the measures fall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, by your patience. If I heard you rightly,</div>
                     <div class="line">The duke hath put on a religious life</div>
                     <div class="line">And thrown into neglect the pompous court?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES DE BOYS</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">To him will I : out of these convertites</div>
                     <div class="line">There is much matter to be heard and learn'd.</div>
                     <p>To DUKE SENIOR</p>
                     <div class="line">You to your former honour I bequeath;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your patience and your virtue well deserves it:</div>
                     <p>To ORLANDO</p>
                     <div class="line">You to a love that your true faith doth merit:</div>
                     <p>To OLIVER</p>
                     <div class="line">You to your land and love and great allies:</div>
                     <p>To SILVIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">You to a long and well-deserved bed:</div>
                     <p>To TOUCHSTONE</p>
                     <div class="line">And you to wrangling; for thy loving voyage</div>
                     <div class="line">Is but for two months victuall'd. So, to your pleasures:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am for other than for dancing measures.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, Jaques, stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                     <div class="line">To see no pastime I what you would have</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll stay to know at your abandon'd cave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SENIOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Proceed, proceed: we will begin these rites,</div>
                     <div class="line">As we do trust they'll end, in true delights.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A dance</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. EPILOGUE</h2>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not the fashion to see the lady the epilogue;</div>
                     <div class="line">but it is no more unhandsome than to see the lord</div>
                     <div class="line">the prologue. If it be true that good wine needs</div>
                     <div class="line">no bush, 'tis true that a good play needs no</div>
                     <div class="line">epilogue; yet to good wine they do use good bushes,</div>
                     <div class="line">and good plays prove the better by the help of good</div>
                     <div class="line">epilogues. What a case am I in then, that am</div>
                     <div class="line">neither a good epilogue nor cannot insinuate with</div>
