                              <div class="line">I thank you for your company; but, good faith, I had</div>
                              <div class="line">as lief have been myself alone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">And so had I; but yet, for fashion sake, I thank you</div>
                              <div class="line">too for your society.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">God be wi' you: let's meet as little as we can.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I do desire we may be better strangers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, mar no more trees with writing</div>
                              <div class="line">love-songs in their barks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, mar no more of my verses with reading</div>
                              <div class="line">them ill-favouredly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">Rosalind is your love's name?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, just.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not like her name.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">There was no thought of pleasing you when she was</div>
                              <div class="line">christened.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">What stature is she of?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Just as high as my heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">You are full of pretty answers. Have you not been</div>
                              <div class="line">acquainted with goldsmiths' wives, and conned them</div>
                              <div class="line">out of rings?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not so; but I answer you right painted cloth, from</div>
                              <div class="line">whence you have studied your questions.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">You have a nimble wit: I think 'twas made of</div>
                              <div class="line">Atalanta's heels. Will you sit down with me? and</div>
                              <div class="line">we two will rail against our mistress the world and</div>
                              <div class="line">all our misery.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I will chide no breather in the world but myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">against whom I know most faults.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">The worst fault you have is to be in love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis a fault I will not change for your best virtue.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am weary of you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">By my troth, I was seeking for a fool when I found</div>
                              <div class="line">you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is drowned in the brook: look but in, and you</div>
                              <div class="line">shall see him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">There I shall see mine own figure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I take to be either a fool or a cipher.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tarry no longer with you: farewell, good</div>
                              <div class="line">Signior Love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am glad of your departure: adieu, good Monsieur</div>
                              <div class="line">Melancholy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit JAQUES</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to CELIA</span>  I will speak to him, like a saucy</div>
                              <div class="line">lackey and under that habit play the knave with him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you hear, forester?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Very well: what would you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, what is't o'clock?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">You should ask me what time o' day: there's no clock</div>
                              <div class="line">in the forest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Then there is no true lover in the forest; else</div>
                              <div class="line">sighing every minute and groaning every hour would</div>
                              <div class="line">detect the lazy foot of Time as well as a clock.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">And why not the swift foot of Time? had not that</div>
                              <div class="line">been as proper?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">By no means, sir: Time travels in divers paces with</div>
                              <div class="line">divers persons. I'll tell you who Time ambles</div>
                              <div class="line">withal, who Time trots withal, who Time gallops</div>
                              <div class="line">withal and who he stands still withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I prithee, who doth he trot withal?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, he trots hard with a young maid between the</div>
                              <div class="line">contract of her marriage and the day it is</div>
                              <div class="line">solemnized: if the interim be but a se'nnight,</div>
                              <div class="line">Time's pace is so hard that it seems the length of</div>
                              <div class="line">seven year.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who ambles Time withal?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">With a priest that lacks Latin and a rich man that</div>
                              <div class="line">hath not the gout, for the one sleeps easily because</div>
                              <div class="line">he cannot study, and the other lives merrily because</div>
                              <div class="line">he feels no pain, the one lacking the burden of lean</div>
                              <div class="line">and wasteful learning, the other knowing no burden</div>
                              <div class="line">of heavy tedious penury; these Time ambles withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who doth he gallop withal?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">With a thief to the gallows, for though he go as</div>
                              <div class="line">softly as foot can fall, he thinks himself too soon there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who stays it still withal?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">With lawyers in the vacation, for they sleep between</div>
                              <div class="line">term and term and then they perceive not how Time moves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Where dwell you, pretty youth?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">With this shepherdess, my sister; here in the</div>
                              <div class="line">skirts of the forest, like fringe upon a petticoat.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you native of this place?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">As the cony that you see dwell where she is kindled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Your accent is something finer than you could</div>
                              <div class="line">purchase in so removed a dwelling.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">I have been told so of many: but indeed an old</div>
                              <div class="line">religious uncle of mine taught me to speak, who was</div>
                              <div class="line">in his youth an inland man; one that knew courtship</div>
                              <div class="line">too well, for there he fell in love. I have heard</div>
                              <div class="line">him read many lectures against it, and I thank God</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not a woman, to be touched with so many</div>
                              <div class="line">giddy offences as he hath generally taxed their</div>
                              <div class="line">whole sex withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Can you remember any of the principal evils that he</div>
                              <div class="line">laid to the charge of women?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">There were none principal; they were all like one</div>
                              <div class="line">another as half-pence are, every one fault seeming</div>
                              <div class="line">monstrous till his fellow fault came to match it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I prithee, recount some of them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">No, I will not cast away my physic but on those that</div>
                              <div class="line">are sick. There is a man haunts the forest, that</div>
                              <div class="line">abuses our young plants with carving 'Rosalind' on</div>
                              <div class="line">their barks; hangs odes upon hawthorns and elegies</div>
                              <div class="line">on brambles, all, forsooth, deifying the name of</div>
                              <div class="line">Rosalind: if I could meet that fancy-monger I would</div>
                              <div class="line">give him some good counsel, for he seems to have the</div>
                              <div class="line">quotidian of love upon him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am he that is so love-shaked: I pray you tell me</div>
                              <div class="line">your remedy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">There is none of my uncle's marks upon you: he</div>
                              <div class="line">taught me how to know a man in love; in which cage</div>
                              <div class="line">of rushes I am sure you are not prisoner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">What were his marks?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">A lean cheek, which you have not, a blue eye and</div>
                              <div class="line">sunken, which you have not, an unquestionable</div>
                              <div class="line">spirit, which you have not, a beard neglected,</div>
                              <div class="line">which you have not; but I pardon you for that, for</div>
                              <div class="line">simply your having in beard is a younger brother's</div>
                              <div class="line">revenue: then your hose should be ungartered, your</div>
                              <div class="line">bonnet unbanded, your sleeve unbuttoned, your shoe</div>
                              <div class="line">untied and every thing about you demonstrating a</div>
                              <div class="line">careless desolation; but you are no such man; you</div>
                              <div class="line">are rather point-device in your accoutrements as</div>
                              <div class="line">loving yourself than seeming the lover of any other.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair youth, I would I could make thee believe I love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Me believe it! you may as soon make her that you</div>
                              <div class="line">love believe it; which, I warrant, she is apter to</div>
                              <div class="line">do than to confess she does: that is one of the</div>
                              <div class="line">points in the which women still give the lie to</div>
                              <div class="line">their consciences. But, in good sooth, are you he</div>
                              <div class="line">that hangs the verses on the trees, wherein Rosalind</div>
                              <div class="line">is so admired?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I swear to thee, youth, by the white hand of</div>
                              <div class="line">Rosalind, I am that he, that unfortunate he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">But are you so much in love as your rhymes speak?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Neither rhyme nor reason can express how much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Love is merely a madness, and, I tell you, deserves</div>
                              <div class="line">as well a dark house and a whip as madmen do: and</div>
                              <div class="line">the reason why they are not so punished and cured</div>
                              <div class="line">is, that the lunacy is so ordinary that the whippers</div>
                              <div class="line">are in love too. Yet I profess curing it by counsel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Did you ever cure any so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, one, and in this manner. He was to imagine me</div>
                              <div class="line">his love, his mistress; and I set him every day to</div>
                              <div class="line">woo me: at which time would I, being but a moonish</div>
                              <div class="line">youth, grieve, be effeminate, changeable, longing</div>
                              <div class="line">and liking, proud, fantastical, apish, shallow,</div>
                              <div class="line">inconstant, full of tears, full of smiles, for every</div>
                              <div class="line">passion something and for no passion truly any</div>
                              <div class="line">thing, as boys and women are for the most part</div>
                              <div class="line">cattle of this colour; would now like him, now loathe</div>
                              <div class="line">him; then entertain him, then forswear him; now weep</div>
                              <div class="line">for him, then spit at him; that I drave my suitor</div>
                              <div class="line">from his mad humour of love to a living humour of</div>
                              <div class="line">madness; which was, to forswear the full stream of</div>
                              <div class="line">the world, and to live in a nook merely monastic.</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus I cured him; and this way will I take upon</div>
                              <div class="line">me to wash your liver as clean as a sound sheep's</div>
                              <div class="line">heart, that there shall not be one spot of love in't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not be cured, youth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">I would cure you, if you would but call me Rosalind</div>
                              <div class="line">and come every day to my cote and woo me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by the faith of my love, I will: tell me</div>
                              <div class="line">where it is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Go with me to it and I'll show it you and by the way</div>
                              <div class="line">you shall tell me where in the forest you live.</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you go?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ORLANDO</div>
                              <div class="line">With all my heart, good youth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay you must call me Rosalind. Come, sister, will you go?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  The forest.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY; JAQUES behind</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">Come apace, good Audrey: I will fetch up your</div>
                              <div class="line">goats, Audrey. And how, Audrey? am I the man yet?</div>
                              <div class="line">doth my simple feature content you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                              <div class="line">Your features! Lord warrant us! what features!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">I am here with thee and thy goats, as the most</div>
                              <div class="line">capricious poet, honest Ovid, was among the Goths.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  O knowledge ill-inhabited, worse than Jove</div>
                              <div class="line">in a thatched house!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">When a man's verses cannot be understood, nor a</div>
                              <div class="line">man's good wit seconded with the forward child</div>
                              <div class="line">Understanding, it strikes a man more dead than a</div>
                              <div class="line">great reckoning in a little room. Truly, I would</div>
                              <div class="line">the gods had made thee poetical.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not know what 'poetical' is: is it honest in</div>
                              <div class="line">deed and word? is it a true thing?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, truly; for the truest poetry is the most</div>
                              <div class="line">feigning; and lovers are given to poetry, and what</div>
                              <div class="line">they swear in poetry may be said as lovers they do feign.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you wish then that the gods had made me poetical?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">I do, truly; for thou swearest to me thou art</div>
                              <div class="line">honest: now, if thou wert a poet, I might have some</div>
                              <div class="line">hope thou didst feign.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                              <div class="line">Would you not have me honest?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, truly, unless thou wert hard-favoured; for</div>
                              <div class="line">honesty coupled to beauty is to have honey a sauce to sugar.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  A material fool!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, I am not fair; and therefore I pray the gods</div>
                              <div class="line">make me honest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">Truly, and to cast away honesty upon a foul slut</div>
                              <div class="line">were to put good meat into an unclean dish.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not a slut, though I thank the gods I am foul.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, praised be the gods for thy foulness!</div>
                              <div class="line">sluttishness may come hereafter. But be it as it may</div>
                              <div class="line">be, I will marry thee, and to that end I have been</div>
                              <div class="line">with Sir Oliver Martext, the vicar of the next</div>
                              <div class="line">village, who hath promised to meet me in this place</div>
                              <div class="line">of the forest and to couple us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  I would fain see this meeting.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUDREY</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, the gods give us joy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">Amen. A man may, if he were of a fearful heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">stagger in this attempt; for here we have no temple</div>
                              <div class="line">but the wood, no assembly but horn-beasts. But what</div>
                              <div class="line">though? Courage! As horns are odious, they are</div>
                              <div class="line">necessary. It is said, 'many a man knows no end of</div>
                              <div class="line">his goods:' right; many a man has good horns, and</div>
                              <div class="line">knows no end of them. Well, that is the dowry of</div>
                              <div class="line">his wife; 'tis none of his own getting. Horns?</div>
                              <div class="line">Even so. Poor men alone? No, no; the noblest deer</div>
                              <div class="line">hath them as huge as the rascal. Is the single man</div>
                              <div class="line">therefore blessed? No: as a walled town is more</div>
                              <div class="line">worthier than a village, so is the forehead of a</div>
                              <div class="line">married man more honourable than the bare brow of a</div>
                              <div class="line">bachelor; and by how much defence is better than no</div>
                              <div class="line">skill, by so much is a horn more precious than to</div>
                              <div class="line">want. Here comes Sir Oliver.</div>
                              <p>Enter SIR OLIVER MARTEXT</p>
                              <div class="line">Sir Oliver Martext, you are well met: will you</div>
                              <div class="line">dispatch us here under this tree, or shall we go</div>
                              <div class="line">with you to your chapel?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR OLIVER MARTEXT</div>
                              <div class="line">Is there none here to give the woman?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not take her on gift of any man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR OLIVER MARTEXT</div>
                              <div class="line">Truly, she must be given, or the marriage is not lawful.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Advancing</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Proceed, proceed I'll give her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">Good even, good Master What-ye-call't: how do you,</div>
                              <div class="line">sir? You are very well met: God 'ild you for your</div>
                              <div class="line">last company: I am very glad to see you: even a</div>
                              <div class="line">toy in hand here, sir: nay, pray be covered.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you be married, motley?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">As the ox hath his bow, sir, the horse his curb and</div>
                              <div class="line">the falcon her bells, so man hath his desires; and</div>
                              <div class="line">as pigeons bill, so wedlock would be nibbling.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">And will you, being a man of your breeding, be</div>
                              <div class="line">married under a bush like a beggar? Get you to</div>
                              <div class="line">church, and have a good priest that can tell you</div>
                              <div class="line">what marriage is: this fellow will but join you</div>
                              <div class="line">together as they join wainscot; then one of you will</div>
                              <div class="line">prove a shrunk panel and, like green timber, warp, warp.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  I am not in the mind but I were better to be</div>
                              <div class="line">married of him than of another: for he is not like</div>
                              <div class="line">to marry me well; and not being well married, it</div>
                              <div class="line">will be a good excuse for me hereafter to leave my wife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JAQUES</div>
                              <div class="line">Go thou with me, and let me counsel thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TOUCHSTONE</div>
                              <div class="line">'Come, sweet Audrey:</div>
                              <div class="line">We must be married, or we must live in bawdry.</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, good Master Oliver: not,--</div>
                              <div class="line">O sweet Oliver,</div>
                              <div class="line">O brave Oliver,</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave me not behind thee: but,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Wind away,</div>
                              <div class="line">Begone, I say,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not to wedding with thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt JAQUES, TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIR OLIVER MARTEXT</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis no matter: ne'er a fantastical knave of them</div>
                              <div class="line">all shall flout me out of my calling.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The forest.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter ROSALIND and CELIA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Never talk to me; I will weep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Do, I prithee; but yet have the grace to consider</div>
                              <div class="line">that tears do not become a man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">But have I not cause to weep?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">As good cause as one would desire; therefore weep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">His very hair is of the dissembling colour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Something browner than Judas's marry, his kisses are</div>
                              <div class="line">Judas's own children.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">I' faith, his hair is of a good colour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">An excellent colour: your chestnut was ever the only colour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">And his kissing is as full of sanctity as the touch</div>
                              <div class="line">of holy bread.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath bought a pair of cast lips of Diana: a nun</div>
                              <div class="line">of winter's sisterhood kisses not more religiously;</div>
                              <div class="line">the very ice of chastity is in them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">But why did he swear he would come this morning, and</div>
                              <div class="line">comes not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, certainly, there is no truth in him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you think so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes; I think he is not a pick-purse nor a</div>
                              <div class="line">horse-stealer, but for his verity in love, I do</div>
                              <div class="line">think him as concave as a covered goblet or a</div>
                              <div class="line">worm-eaten nut.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">Not true in love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, when he is in; but I think he is not in.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">You have heard him swear downright he was.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">'Was' is not 'is:' besides, the oath of a lover is</div>
                              <div class="line">no stronger than the word of a tapster; they are</div>
                              <div class="line">both the confirmer of false reckonings. He attends</div>
                              <div class="line">here in the forest on the duke your father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">I met the duke yesterday and had much question with</div>
                              <div class="line">him: he asked me of what parentage I was; I told</div>
                              <div class="line">him, of as good as he; so he laughed and let me go.</div>
                              <div class="line">But what talk we of fathers, when there is such a</div>
                              <div class="line">man as Orlando?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, that's a brave man! he writes brave verses,</div>
                              <div class="line">speaks brave words, swears brave oaths and breaks</div>
                              <div class="line">them bravely, quite traverse, athwart the heart of</div>
                              <div class="line">his lover; as a puisny tilter, that spurs his horse</div>
                              <div class="line">but on one side, breaks his staff like a noble</div>
                              <div class="line">goose: but all's brave that youth mounts and folly</div>
                              <div class="line">guides. Who comes here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CORIN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                              <div class="line">Mistress and master, you have oft inquired</div>
                              <div class="line">After the shepherd that complain'd of love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who you saw sitting by me on the turf,</div>
                              <div class="line">Praising the proud disdainful shepherdess</div>
                              <div class="line">That was his mistress.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CELIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, and what of him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CORIN</div>
                              <div class="line">If you will see a pageant truly play'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Between the pale complexion of true love</div>
                              <div class="line">And the red glow of scorn and proud disdain,</div>
                              <div class="line">Go hence a little and I shall conduct you,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you will mark it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">O, come, let us remove:</div>
                              <div class="line">The sight of lovers feedeth those in love.</div>
                              <div class="line">Bring us to this sight, and you shall say</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll prove a busy actor in their play.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  Another part of the forest.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SILVIUS and PHEBE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Phebe, do not scorn me; do not, Phebe;</div>
                              <div class="line">Say that you love me not, but say not so</div>
                              <div class="line">In bitterness. The common executioner,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose heart the accustom'd sight of death makes hard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Falls not the axe upon the humbled neck</div>
                              <div class="line">But first begs pardon: will you sterner be</div>
                              <div class="line">Than he that dies and lives by bloody drops?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter ROSALIND, CELIA, and CORIN, behind</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not be thy executioner:</div>
                              <div class="line">I fly thee, for I would not injure thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou tell'st me there is murder in mine eye:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis pretty, sure, and very probable,</div>
                              <div class="line">That eyes, that are the frail'st and softest things,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who shut their coward gates on atomies,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should be call'd tyrants, butchers, murderers!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now I do frown on thee with all my heart;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if mine eyes can wound, now let them kill thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now counterfeit to swoon; why now fall down;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or if thou canst not, O, for shame, for shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lie not, to say mine eyes are murderers!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now show the wound mine eye hath made in thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Scratch thee but with a pin, and there remains</div>
                              <div class="line">Some scar of it; lean but upon a rush,</div>
                              <div class="line">The cicatrice and capable impressure</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy palm some moment keeps; but now mine eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I have darted at thee, hurt thee not,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor, I am sure, there is no force in eyes</div>
                              <div class="line">That can do hurt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O dear Phebe,</div>
                              <div class="line">If ever,--as that ever may be near,--</div>
                              <div class="line">You meet in some fresh cheek the power of fancy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then shall you know the wounds invisible</div>
                              <div class="line">That love's keen arrows make.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">But till that time</div>
                              <div class="line">Come not thou near me: and when that time comes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Afflict me with thy mocks, pity me not;</div>
                              <div class="line">As till that time I shall not pity thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">And why, I pray you? Who might be your mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you insult, exult, and all at once,</div>
                              <div class="line">Over the wretched? What though you have no beauty,--</div>
                              <div class="line">As, by my faith, I see no more in you</div>
                              <div class="line">Than without candle may go dark to bed--</div>
                              <div class="line">Must you be therefore proud and pitiless?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, what means this? Why do you look on me?</div>
                              <div class="line">I see no more in you than in the ordinary</div>
                              <div class="line">Of nature's sale-work. 'Od's my little life,</div>
                              <div class="line">I think she means to tangle my eyes too!</div>
                              <div class="line">No, faith, proud mistress, hope not after it:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not your inky brows, your black silk hair,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your bugle eyeballs, nor your cheek of cream,</div>
                              <div class="line">That can entame my spirits to your worship.</div>
                              <div class="line">You foolish shepherd, wherefore do you follow her,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like foggy south puffing with wind and rain?</div>
                              <div class="line">You are a thousand times a properer man</div>
                              <div class="line">Than she a woman: 'tis such fools as you</div>
                              <div class="line">That makes the world full of ill-favour'd children:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not her glass, but you, that flatters her;</div>
                              <div class="line">And out of you she sees herself more proper</div>
                              <div class="line">Than any of her lineaments can show her.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, mistress, know yourself: down on your knees,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thank heaven, fasting, for a good man's love:</div>
                              <div class="line">For I must tell you friendly in your ear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sell when you can: you are not for all markets:</div>
                              <div class="line">Cry the man mercy; love him; take his offer:</div>
                              <div class="line">Foul is most foul, being foul to be a scoffer.</div>
                              <div class="line">So take her to thee, shepherd: fare you well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet youth, I pray you, chide a year together:</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather hear you chide than this man woo.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">He's fallen in love with your foulness and she'll</div>
                              <div class="line">fall in love with my anger. If it be so, as fast as</div>
                              <div class="line">she answers thee with frowning looks, I'll sauce her</div>
                              <div class="line">with bitter words. Why look you so upon me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">For no ill will I bear you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROSALIND</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, do not fall in love with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">For I am falser than vows made in wine:</div>
                              <div class="line">Besides, I like you not. If you will know my house,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis at the tuft of olives here hard by.</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you go, sister? Shepherd, ply her hard.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, sister. Shepherdess, look on him better,</div>
                              <div class="line">And be not proud: though all the world could see,</div>
                              <div class="line">None could be so abused in sight as he.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, to our flock.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt ROSALIND, CELIA and CORIN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">Dead Shepherd, now I find thy saw of might,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Who ever loved that loved not at first sight?'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Phebe,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha, what say'st thou, Silvius?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Phebe, pity me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, I am sorry for thee, gentle Silvius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherever sorrow is, relief would be:</div>
                              <div class="line">If you do sorrow at my grief in love,</div>
                              <div class="line">By giving love your sorrow and my grief</div>
                              <div class="line">Were both extermined.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast my love: is not that neighbourly?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I would have you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that were covetousness.</div>
                              <div class="line">Silvius, the time was that I hated thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet it is not that I bear thee love;</div>
                              <div class="line">But since that thou canst talk of love so well,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy company, which erst was irksome to me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will endure, and I'll employ thee too:</div>
                              <div class="line">But do not look for further recompense</div>
                              <div class="line">Than thine own gladness that thou art employ'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">So holy and so perfect is my love,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I in such a poverty of grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I shall think it a most plenteous crop</div>
                              <div class="line">To glean the broken ears after the man</div>
                              <div class="line">That the main harvest reaps: loose now and then</div>
                              <div class="line">A scatter'd smile, and that I'll live upon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">Know'st now the youth that spoke to me erewhile?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Not very well, but I have met him oft;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he hath bought the cottage and the bounds</div>
                              <div class="line">That the old carlot once was master of.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">Think not I love him, though I ask for him:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis but a peevish boy; yet he talks well;</div>
                              <div class="line">But what care I for words? yet words do well</div>
                              <div class="line">When he that speaks them pleases those that hear.</div>
                              <div class="line">It is a pretty youth: not very pretty:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, sure, he's proud, and yet his pride becomes him:</div>
                              <div class="line">He'll make a proper man: the best thing in him</div>
                              <div class="line">Is his complexion; and faster than his tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">Did make offence his eye did heal it up.</div>
                              <div class="line">He is not very tall; yet for his years he's tall:</div>
                              <div class="line">His leg is but so so; and yet 'tis well:</div>
                              <div class="line">There was a pretty redness in his lip,</div>
                              <div class="line">A little riper and more lusty red</div>
                              <div class="line">Than that mix'd in his cheek; 'twas just the difference</div>
                              <div class="line">Between the constant red and mingled damask.</div>
                              <div class="line">There be some women, Silvius, had they mark'd him</div>
                              <div class="line">In parcels as I did, would have gone near</div>
                              <div class="line">To fall in love with him; but, for my part,</div>
                              <div class="line">I love him not nor hate him not; and yet</div>
                              <div class="line">I have more cause to hate him than to love him:</div>
                              <div class="line">For what had he to do to chide at me?</div>
                              <div class="line">He said mine eyes were black and my hair black:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, now I am remember'd, scorn'd at me:</div>
                              <div class="line">I marvel why I answer'd not again:</div>
                              <div class="line">But that's all one; omittance is no quittance.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll write to him a very taunting letter,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt bear it: wilt thou, Silvius?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILVIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Phebe, with all my heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PHEBE</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll write it straight;</div>
                              <div class="line">The matter's in my head and in my heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will be bitter with him and passing short.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go with me, Silvius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  The forest.</a>
                           </span>
